Title: Entry Level Civil / Structural Engineer
Job Description:
ENERCON is a multi-disciplinary engineering and environmental services firm dedicated to driving efficiency and sustainability throughout energy, power, and related technology industries. Our culture is defined by our commitment to excellence and investment in our employee’s growth and development.
Due to continued growth, our Nuclear Services Group is seeking an Entry Level Civil / Structural Engineer for our Kennesaw, GA, Naperville, IL, and Overland Park, KS locations.
Responsibilities (including but are not limited to)
Designing and preparing engineering design packages for existing nuclear power plants or new plant elements.
Applying basic technical principles, theories, standards, and concepts in order to put together engineering design packages.
Reading and understanding design drawings and technical specifications to support the preparation of project deliverables such as calculations, specifications, and engineering evaluations.
Gaining familiarity with and application of industry codes and government regulations.
Ability to learn discipline-specific computer analysis codes.
Working on a multidisciplinary team.
Interfacing with other staff engineers as well as engineers working for our clients.
Conducting site walkdowns at different nuclear clients’ sites.
Required Qualifications / skills
Bachelor of Science in Civil/Structural Engineering from an ABET accredited school.
College transcript needed for anyone under 1 year of experience post graduation
Familiarity with preparing calculations.
Proficient in Microsoft Suite.
Excellent writing, presentation and communication skills.
Ability to be an individual contributor and work effectively in teams.
Ability to gain and maintain unescorted access at nuclear sites.
Must be able to traverse stairs and ladders at client sites.
Must be able to traverse client sites to conduct walkdowns.
Must be able to work outside at client sites in all weather conditions.
Ability to travel between 15-25% of the time; duration of travel may vary depending on project and client needs, ranging from a few days to a few weeks. Position may involve a client site assignment lasting several months at a time.
Employment requirement
Ability to pass a pre-employment and random drug and alcohol screenings, ENERCON and client specific background checks, and annual motor vehicle record (MVR) according to company and client policies.
Must be legally eligible to work in the US without current or future sponsorship.
This job posting is subject to change at any time.
Enercon Services, Inc (ENERCON) offers excellent benefits and career opportunities as part of our culture of excellence. Our people are the driving force behind our work. Together, we advance industry and drive innovation.
ENERCON does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Entry Level Structural Engineer - Summer 2023
Job Description:
Our People & Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the "why" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.

Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.


Your Impact:

At Jacobs, we’re not just building structures, we’re helping our clients innovate and grow by designing, engineering, and executing the construction of their state-of-the-art facilities that are changing our world.
Join our team in Cincinnati, OH as a Structural Engineer and get excited about working on projects that enable the heart of our clients’ business. You’ll have the chance to work on projects including the design of new structures as well as existing structural upgrades. With mentorship and guidance from our Professional Engineers and technical experts, you’ll be accountable for schedule and technical quality of assigned engineering tasks, as you gain familiarity with the client’s expectations, scope, budget and schedule for assigned tasks. You’ll effectively recognize and communicate scope and design changes promptly while designing structures to withstand stresses and pressures imposed through environmental conditions and human use. You will impact projects regularly by evaluating the desired goal of the system and developing, designing, or selecting the required materials, structures and earthwork to achieve that goal.
Bring your curiosity, talent for multi-tasking and extreme organizational skills and we’ll help you grow, pursue and fulfill what drives you – so we can make big impacts on the world, together.
Here’s What You’ll Need:
BS or MS in a Structural or Civil Engineering or another closely related engineering discipline
Ideally you will also have
EIT certification or ability to obtain
AutoCAD drafting and 3D/BIM modeling.
Autodesk REVIT
3D Structural Analysis and Design software: STAAD Pro, RAM Elements or RAM Structural System, RISA
#LS #LifeSciences
Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding), age, medical condition, marital or domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression and transgender status, mental disability or physical disability, genetic information, military or veteran status, citizenship, low-income status or any other status or characteristic protected by applicable law. Learn more about your rights under Federal EEO laws and supplemental language.

At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private sector.

Title: Structural Engineer
Job Description:
Description:
K2M Design is looking for positive contributors to our culture, that are passionate about meeting the demanding needs of our clients, and add value and impact through expertise - all in turn contributing to the growth of K2M.


If you are a Structural Engineer and believe in Building Relationships Based on Trust and Results - we need you! Position is located in any of K2M's office locations, or fully remote for the right candidate.
As a Structural Engineer your main responsibility will be in project design and plan preparation, review submittals, RFIs and conduct site observations.
Job Responsibilities:
Expanding the company’s engineering breadth by growing and maintaining client relationships.
Collects and prepares data/information and performs engineering calculations.
Responsible for the production of CAD drawings that are of high quality being consistent, complete and accurate.
Develops technical specifications & data sheets.
Assists in field work, checking installations, and problem solving activities.
Performs calculation checking and vendor drawing reviews.
Interacts with other departments and suppliers to obtain pertinent information.
Knowledgeable in the design of structural systems including foundation (matt, pile, slab-on-grade), framing design, bearing wall, roof design, specialized systems, calculations, specification writing.
Confers with project staff for resourcing availability.
Coordination between all A/E disciplines on a project.
Ensure project progresses on schedule and within prescribed budget.
Assist in the preparation of project reports for management, client, or others.
Confers with project personnel to provide technical advice and to resolve problems.
Construction administration, shop drawings review, response to request for information
K2M's Benefits and Perks:
Time off: 10 paid annual holidays, plus open PTO to balance work and life as well as 2 weeks of paid leave for new parents
Health Insurance: Medical, dental and vision benefits, plus life and short term disability coverage
Retirement: matched 401k plan, up to 4% when you contribute 5%
Empowered People: Fundamental that is built into how we operate
Fun work environment: Flexible schedule, casual environment, contagious accountability
Requirements:
A bachelor’s degree in Civil or Architectural Engineering with a concentration in Structural Engineering or equivalent.
PE (Preferred) or EIT registered (Required).
Professional experience in the A/E field required.
Diversified experience is preferred, such as concrete, tilt-up, wood, steel framed structures as well as low-rise and mid-rise.
Experience with RAM and Enercalc is required.
Experience with Woodworks, SAP2000 is a plus.
Proficiency in AutoCAD and Revit is required.
Position only available to candidates residing in EST and CST time zones.

Title: Structural Engineer (Entry Level)
Job Description:
Overview:
Robert Silman Associates Structural Engineers, D.P.C., a TYLin Company, is an award-winning structural engineering firm based in New York City with offices in Boston, Washington, DC, Ann Arbor, Chicago, and Los Angeles. Silman is a diverse and energetic firm of 160 employees who bring passion and creativity to the job. In our 55-year history, Silman has fostered an approach centered on constant collaboration between owners, architects, and consultants to provide quality structural engineering services for our clients. Engineers will be exposed to a broad spectrum of renovation, preservation, and new construction projects across all architectural practice areas. If you’re looking to continue expanding your skills and knowledge with a dynamic, growing firm, Silman could be a great fit for you!

We are seeking an entry-level Structural Engineer for buildings projects. This position will report to the Principal, and will require 0-3 years of experience in the structural design of various building types.

Please submit a cover letter and copy of your unofficial transcript with your application.
Responsibilities:
Work with the project team to prepare structural design and drawings for buildings (commercial, institutional, residential) from conceptual and preliminary stages of design through to completion.
Perform field review for projects under construction.
Other responsibilities as assigned.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Civil or Architectural Engineering (with a focus on structures preferred)
0-3 years of relevant experience in the execution of commercial, institutional, or residential projects preferred.
Familiarity with REVIT Structure would be beneficial.
Client focused, always striving to give clients the best solutions.
Strong commitment to innovation by creating new and better ways to solve clients’ toughest challenges.
High levels of integrity, always doing the right thing in an ethical, fair, and sustainable way.
Demonstrated experience of collaboration in a diverse and inclusive team, working together toward technical excellence.

The Company is proud to offer a comprehensive total rewards package. Our benefits include extensive health, dental, vision, disability and life insurance coverage, continuing education benefits, paid time off, flexible spending accounts, employee assistance program and a retirement savings plan with company matching contributions. We encourage all candidates to explore our total rewards offering.

The Company is an equal opportunity employer and we prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type as protected by federal, state, or local laws. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. The Company remains committed to complying with all local health authority, legal or lawful client requirements, as such this role may be situated in a jurisdiction with masking or vaccinate or test requirements to attend office or client locations (controlled location). You should ask your manager about this prior to starting. Should you be subject to the requirements, you are required to disclose your vaccination status within the first week of starting or before entering a controlled location, whichever comes first.

Title: Structural Engineer - Entry Level
Job Description:
Office Location Orange County - Irvine, CA
Post Date 2023-03-01
Team Orange County - Irvine, CA

One of the largest national Structural and Civil Engineering firms, KPFF Consulting Engineers works with Architects, Developers, Contractors, and Public Agencies to provide Structural and Civil Engineering services. Our projects range in size and scope, and we are always striving to grow our presence in our communities.
The Orange County office is looking for structural engineers who are eager to start their careers in structural engineering. We give many opportunities to young engineers to experience firsthand the many facets of structural engineering while working alongside seasoned professionals in a collaborative environment.
Desired Education and Experience:
B.S. degree in Civil/Structural Engineering from an accredited university, M.S. degree with a specialty in Structural Engineering preferred
E.I.T. certification preferred
0-2 years of experience in building design
Ideal Candidate:
Desires to develop a breadth and depth of knowledge in the field
Communicates clearly and professionally, both verbally and in writing
Excels in collaborative environments
Is familiar with codes and standards applicable to the design and construction of building projects located in California
Is familiar with typically utilized computer software programs (ETABS, RISA-3D, RAM Structural System, SAP2000, SAFE, SP Concrete Design)
Structural Engineer Responsibilities:
Prepare calculations and construction documents under the supervision of the Project Manager
Perform construction administration services under the supervision of the Project Manager
Interface with clients on project specific issues
Quality control of technical content
Grow in technical knowledge through attendance of in-house education opportunities

Title: Structural Engineer (Forensics)
Job Description:
Engage Engineer Search LLC is searching for a qualified Forensic Structural Engineer to add to our client's engineering team. Our client is a nationwide, forensic engineering firm that specializes in commercial forensic investigations. With a team of experienced engineers located throughout the nation, our client provides timely engineering solutions and is committed to technical excellence and professionalism. Our client's team utilizes cutting-edge field equipment and process automation to generate deliverables and advice before leaving the site. Our client has a tightly-knit team that comes together daily to share the workload, experience, and support.
Our client is searching for a full-time Forensic Structural Engineer in the area of Houston, Texas. This position would be remote and you would work from your home office. This is an opportunity to be involved in challenging projects and to provide technical solutions. You will conduct structural field investigations and analyze failures involving various structural and construction related problems involving commercial and industrial properties.
Essential Job Functions & Responsibilities:
Determine of the origin and cause, and extent of structural failures, water intrusions, roof damage, construction defects and building system failures including envelope, roof, wall and glazing
Analyze failures in buildings and other infrastructure systems by conducting site visits and applying engineering principles and practices in accordance with codes and industry standards
Conduct unbiased investigations for various types of clients
Prepare oral and written reports in layman's terms that document causes of failure, extent of loss, and recommended remediation.
Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies.
Position Requirements:
Bachelor's Degree required, Master's Degree preferred in Civil or Structural Engineering
P. E. (Professional Engineer) certification in state of residency
Valid Driver's License
Must possess strong writing skills
Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills
Physical Requirements:
Ability to lift 20 lbs.
Ability to climb ladders and inspect roofs
Ability to maneuver in and around buildings and in confined spaces
Ability to drive to site locations
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $80,000.00 - $110,000.00 per year
Benefits:
401(k)
401(k) matching
Dental insurance
Flexible schedule
Health insurance
Life insurance
Paid time off
Professional development assistance
Tuition reimbursement
Vision insurance
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Supplemental pay types:
Bonus pay
Experience:
forensic engineering: 1 year (Required)
License/Certification:
Professional Engineer certification (Required)
Willingness to travel:
25% (Required)
Work Location: Remote

Health insurance

Title: Product Design FEA Engineer
Job Description:
Summary
Posted: Mar 8, 2023
Role Number: 200169799
Help Apple grow the product structural analysis team for iPad, iPhone, Mac, Watch, and many other Apple products. We are responsible for FEA modeling, engineering analysis, & material characterization, along with verification and validation of mechanical simulation models.
Key Qualifications
Thorough knowledge of Solid Mechanics and Strength of Materials
Passion for creating innovative, high quality products
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills
Desire to work in a fast-paced environment
Description
We are fully integrated with the product design team from the earliest stages, analyzing and informing the mechanical design of ground breaking products. As part of our team, you will work with the multi-functional teams within Apple and with outside vendors to characterize the strength of raw materials and components.
Education & Experience
At least MS in Mechanical Engineering, Applied Mechanics, or similar.
Additional Requirements
Additional Experience in any or all of the following areas would be preferred:
Static and dynamic finite element analysis (ideally in handheld/portable/wearable electronic products)
FEA software such as Abaqus or similar
Good modeling practices including model validation techniques
Failure modeling of different classes of materials
Testing including methods using Digital Image Correlation, Universal Testing Machines, and Dynamic Mechanical Analysis
Pay & Benefits
At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $115,000 and $217,500, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.

Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses — including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits.

Note: Apple benefit, compensation and employee stock programs are subject to eligibility requirements and other terms of the applicable plan or program.

Title: Structural Engineer
Job Description:
Job description
Looking for a qualified Structural Engineer whom is willing to work remote (coast to coast) for building in
Washington State or work within our office in Seattle Hybrid or full time. We are more interested in quality than location. Must be able to gain Washington State licensure through reciprocity (NCEES or otherwise).
Drafting of plans in Revit can be accomplished through drafting staff if required, but Revit skill is looked upon favorably. Signing and sealing ones own documents is paramount. A pipe line full of work and need of skilled professionals needed to augment the existing architectural team. Ability to communicate through bluebeam and e-mail a definite plus. The position is full time salaried.
Who We Are.
We are a fully-integrated real estate development company with Architectural and Engineering departments. We were locally founded in Seattle, Washington and have remained a family-owned and operated company since 1992, over the last 20+ years, our company has specialized in managing multifamily communities. In the last few years we have decided to take on ground up construction projects. We have completed 5 multifamily communities as a company. We currently own and manage 18 properties across the greater Seattle area and surrounding. We manage all aspects of Real Estate
Development including Engineering and Design, Acquisitions, Development, Construction Management,
Property Management and Asset Management.
Our Goals
Our goal at Bode is to create affordable living options in Seattle and surrounding areas. If you're a
Structural Engineer who values accountability, integrity, teamwork and commitment, you will fit right in with Bode's values and mission.
Our organization's mission is to demonstrate excellence in designing, developing, building and managing real property through teamwork and integrity . Our dedicated professionals provide quality and value for our customers, profitability for our investors and a lasting contribution to our community. Learn more about us at livingbode.com
The candidate that will join our team:
Will have the opportunity to contribute to new innovative design/construction workflows.
Will have multi-family construction experience
Will provide structural oversight and calculations for permit submittals
Will have a passion for leveraging technology to innovate design and construction processes.
Work is remote across the County with ability to gain licensure in Washington State.
As a Structural Engineer, your roles and responsibilities will include:
Manage a stream of jobs requiring structural review & design.
Perform structural engineering calculations for wood-framed over concrete structures (5 wood over 2 concrete/steel) for 7 story low-rise per Seattle code.
Revise structural calculations per jurisdiction comments, and provide response letters to jurisdictions when needed.
Review early-stage projects for structural feasibility/completeness.
Stamp structural calculation packages and associated drawing sets for permit and construction.
Coordinate with Design and Construction teams for the digital twin process.
Contribute to innovation of design and construction workflows and processes.
Review plan sets for completeness and accuracy
Design all revisions of project drawings & specifications.
Effective communication and project management; follow up as needed throughout the permitting process & contract administration.
Working hard, playing hard, enjoying the challenge!
Requisite Qualifications:
A Bachelors Degree in Engineering.
Washington State Professional Structural Engineer’s License or ability to gain such by Reciprocity through the NCEES or individually -or- A Professional Engineers license with the ability to gain a Structural Engineers license in Washington State within 6 months to 1 year of starting.
4-8+ years of professional structural engineering experience - construction industry experience will be looked upon favorably.
Open to innovative technological practices and workflows for delivering projects
Ability to develop and maintain business relationships with all levels of key-related companies, the decision-makers at these companies being a primary focus.
Skilled at Information management through construction software (i.e. Procore, Autodesk Build or similar.)
Experience with building codes, specifications, building and engineering systems.
Is motivated and a self-starter with experience in wood-framed & concrete / Steel construction
Dedicated, dynamic, detail-oriented, collaborative, professional, and results-oriented person.
Proficient with Revit, Bluebeam, AutoCAD and other A/E/C software as needed.
Effective verbal and written communication skills.
Collaborative and with professional work ethic.
Licensure required or ability to gain such through Reciprocity.
What You'll Enjoy
A competitive base salary based on the state living in and local Seattle wages average.
Medical, dental and vision insurance for you and your family members.
401K plan.
Paid vacation starting at 60 days.
Paid Sick Leave.
5 Paid Holidays.
Ongoing training and employee development.
Conditions of Employment
All candidates must submit a resume and work samples. Include your resume and a compact, representative sample of your work (no larger than 4MB) to be considered for this position.
Living Bode is committed to building a diverse company work environment based on equity and inclusion.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $85,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year
Benefits:
401(k)
Dental insurance
Flexible schedule
Health insurance
Paid time off
Vision insurance
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Supplemental pay types:
Bonus pay
License/Certification:
Professional Engineer License (Required)
Willingness to travel:
25% (Preferred)
Work Location: Remote

Health insurance

Title: Aerospace Structural Engineer III
Job Description:
Description
Job Description:

Looking for an opportunity to make an impact?

At Leidos, we deliver innovative solutions through the efforts of our diverse and talented people who are dedicated to our customers’ success. We empower our teams, contribute to our communities, and operate sustainably. Everything we do is built on a commitment to do the right thing for our customers, our people, and our community. Our Mission, Vision, and Values guide the way we do business.
Are you ready for your next challenge?
The Defense Group at Leidos QRC Airborne ISR Systems Division has an opening for an Aerospace Structural Engineer to work in our Bridgewater, VA office. This is an exciting opportunity to use your experience helping the Leidos mission. In this mission, we provide aerial intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance platforms for today’s warfighter.
THE CHALLENGE (primary responsibilities)
Perform static, linear structural analysis for modifications to FAR Part 23 and Part 25 aircraft.
Analyze metallic and composite structures using both Finite Element Analysis (FEA) and classical hand calculation methodology.
Write and review structural test plans, test reports, and structural analysis reports.
Serve as the programmatic structures lead for the design development of aircrafts. Ensuring all deliverable deadlines are met and all systems have analysis coverage as applicable to include static structural analysis, Damage Tolerance Analysis (DTA), and Instructions for Continued Airworthiness (ICA).
Provide mechanical design recommendations based on structural design principles and analysis results.
Present analysis assumptions and results during internal and external design reviews.
Collaborate with Integrated Product Teams to plan and execute all technical and production functions.
Mentor engineers in areas of stress analysis, design, and fabrication methods.
Review and approve design deviation requests and non-conformance reports.
Peer review and approve structural analysis reports and drawings of other engineers.
WHAT SETS YOU APART (basic qualifications)
Bachelor’s degree in engineering or STEM field
4+ years of experience in engineering development and product lifecycle management
4+ years experience with airplane or helicopter analysis
Experience with FAR Part 23 and Part 25 aircraft certification.
Experience in structural analysis of metallic and composite aircraft structure.
Experience with all phases of the development lifecycle including planning, conceptual design, requirements definition, preliminary design, prototyping, test and evaluation, detailed design, integration, formal verification, entry to production, etc.
Strong engineering analytical and technical writing skills with demonstrated experience authoring technical reports and supporting design reviews.
Effective communication & interpersonal skills with ability to present data and explain results to leadership, subordinates & peers.
Leadership, teambuilding, and mentoring skills.
Ability to effectively work within a multi-functional and diverse team.
Proficiency in presenting complex information to both technical and non-technical management personnel and other stakeholders.
Security Clearance Requirement
Eligible to obtain and maintain a minimum of Secret security clearance.
Preferred Qualifications
Ability to work on multiple projects in various stages simultaneously.
Proficient in using Finite Element Modeling software – FEMAP NX Nastran.
Experience using Computer-Aided Design (CAD) platforms – SolidWorks.
Experience with Fatigue and Damage Tolerance Analysis.
Proficiency using presentation software to explain complex information to both technical and non-technical management personnel and other stakeholders.
Experience performing cost and schedule management.
Pay Range:
Pay Range $78,000.00 - $120,000.00 - $162,000.00
The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.

Title: Structural Engineer
Job Description:
Mueser Rutledge Consulting Engineers, PLLC, (MRCE) is a renowned specialty geotechnical and foundation engineering design firm. The MRCE New York City office has an immediate opening for new graduates and Structural Engineers with 0-3 years of experience.
Area of Practice
MRCE specializes in the areas of:
· Geotechnical Engineering
· Structural Design:
o High Capacity Foundations
o Support of Excavation (SOE)
o Deep Excavations
o Slurry Walls, Secant Pile Walls, etc.
o Tunnels and Shafts
o Waterfront Structures
o Flood Control and Dams
o Groundwater Barriers and Collection Systems
o Earthwork, Ground Improvement, and Geotechnical Structures
· Earthquake Engineering
· Emergency Response
· Construction Support and Inspection
· Instrumentation and Monitoring
· Design Build
Job description
Job duties include planning and inspection of subsurface investigations, analysis and design; design and installation of instrumentation and performance monitoring; preparation of reports, construction drawings, project specifications and quantity/cost estimates.
Qualifications
A Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering with a Structural Engineering focus, or Master of Science in Geotechnical Engineering or Structural Engineering from an ABET accredited college is required.
The candidate must have a thorough knowledge of engineering technical principles and have excellent verbal and written communications skills. The candidate must possess a professional can-do attitude, must be hard-working, organized, and capable of working independently and as a member of a team in a group setting. Experience using AutoCAD and/or MicroStation, MathCAD, and experience using specialty analysis software is required.
How To Reach MRCE
To learn more about MRCE and to submit your resume, visit our website at www.MRCE.com
MRCE is an equal opportunity employer and considers all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, gender, pregnancy, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information, service in the uniformed services, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law.

Title: Senior Facilities Civil/Structural Engineer
Job Description:
At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.
We are seeking a Senior Facilities Civil/Structural Engineer, Level 4, to join our Engineering and Technology (E&T) team within Facilities and Asset Management. This position is located in Tukwila, Washington.
You will focus on structural design & structural and seismic analysis for building systems and equipment support, including foundation design, roadway repair, and building modifications as well as support to large equipment installation projects.
Position Responsibilities:
Leads project teams to develop moderately complex conceptual designs, final designs, cost estimates and provides maintenance support for the structural phases of buildings, equipment installations, utility systems and grounds including advanced seismic designs
Reviews structural/seismic designs to assess compliance with customer requirements, building codes and regulations by applying knowledge of construction principles, practices, and materials
Leads teams to ensure accuracy of drawing archives/libraries by reviewing contractor redlines. Identifies errors and documents construction changes to align with regulatory requirements, facility standards, and record retention requirements
Leads production or procurement of detailed design documents; uses appropriate resources to produce project drawings, specifications, and permit application packages in accordance with project parameters; coordinates designs; reviews and approves documents; offers project alternatives to assure compliance
Provides recommendations to strategic, short-term, and long-term infrastructure planning; completes studies; analyzes current conditions and future requirements; recommends capital improvements; captures and analyzes data; and works with both internal and external customers to identify and assess alternatives and impacts
Leads in interpretation and analysis of regulations, standards, codes, and ordinances with respect to project requirements
Translates customer requirements into conceptual design by analyzing intended use/occupancy and desired aesthetics, conducting code research, developing preliminary design elements, determining interdisciplinary engineering support requirements, estimating resource costs/requirements, identifying materials, equipment, and services; and developing initial project schedule in order to establish project scope
This position is expected to be 100% onsite. The selected candidate will be required to work onsite in Tukwila, Washington.
This position must meet export control compliance requirements. To meet export control compliance requirements, a “U.S. Person” as defined by 22 C.F.R. §120.15 is required. “U.S. Person” includes U.S. Citizen, lawful permanent resident, refugee, or asylee.

Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):
Bachelor of Science degree or greater in an engineering related field
10+ years of experience in structural engineering
5+ years of experience using AutoCAD (or similar CAD package)
5+ years of experience reading & understanding engineering drawings, blueprints, schematics, and specifications

Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience):
10+ years of experience in design, analysis and evaluation of building structures, including foundations, roofing, framing, floors, equipment supports, seismic bracing, roadways, etc.
5+ years of experience leading engineering or construction projects
5+ years of experience with building and safety codes
5+ years of experience leading industrial engineers and influencing cross-functional teams
Experience working in a production environment
Typical Education & Experience:
Education/experience typically acquired through advanced technical education from an accredited course of study in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics or chemistry (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 9 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of technical education and experience (e.g. PhD+4 years' related work experience, Master + 7 years' related work experience). In the USA, ABET accreditation is the preferred, although not required, accreditation standard.
Relocation:
This position offers relocation based on candidate eligibility.
Shift:
This position is for 1st shift.
Drug Free Workplace:
Boeing is a Drug Free Workplace where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies.
Union:
This is a union represented position.
At Boeing, we strive to deliver a Total Rewards package that will attract, engage and retain the top talent. Elements of the Total Rewards package include competitive base pay and variable compensation opportunities.
The Boeing Company also provides eligible employees with an opportunity to enroll in a variety of benefit programs, generally including health insurance, flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance programs, and a number of programs that provide for both paid and unpaid time away from work.
The specific programs and options available to any given employee may vary depending on eligibility factors such as geographic location, date of hire, and the applicability of collective bargaining agreements.
Please note that the salary information shown below is a general guideline only. Salaries are based upon candidate experience and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations.
Summary pay range: $119,850– $162,150.

Export Control Requirements: U.S. Government Export Control Status: This position must meet export control compliance requirements. To meet export control compliance requirements, a “U.S. Person” as defined by 22 C.F.R. §120.15 is required. “U.S. Person” includes U.S. Citizen, lawful permanent resident, refugee, or asylee.

Export Control Details: US based job, US Person required

Equal Opportunity Employer:
Boeing is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military/veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Title: Structural Engineer
Job Description:
BACKGROUND
General Forensic Engineers works with clients in the insurance and legal industries to investigate and analyze various storm-damaged properties, building design and construction deficiencies, and structural failures. Projects involve investigations of residential and commercial buildings ranging from substructure, superstructure, and roofing condition evaluations including code compliance and history.
ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES
· Conduct investigations to gather and analyze structural failures such as movement of a structure, deflections, cracking, complete failure, water intrusion, ventilation, and structural adequacy of a building.
· Complete residential structural and roofing inspections, design work, site improvement, grading, and drainage plans.
· Responsible for commercial and industrial projects ranging from light to heavy.
· Prepare technical reports.
· Provide expert testimony as required.
REQUIREMENTS
· Masters in Civil Engineering, Structural Engineering or related field; Bachelors considered.
· PE licensure in FL desired; willingness to obtain Florida PE.
· The expert candidate will be willing to work in the litigation setting and be allowed to evaluate cases and claims.
· Prior litigation experience (testifying experience) is preferred but not required; however, the expert candidate must possess solid written and verbal communication skills.
Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract
Pay: $55,800.00 - $135,000.00 per year
License/Certification:
Professional Engineer in Florida (Required)
Work Location: Remote

Title: Entry Level Structural Integrity Engineer
Job Description:
Title:
Entry Level Structural Integrity Engineer
KBR ISA Advisory Consulting provides specialty structural engineering and integrity management services for the energy industry. The company is client focused and prides itself on developing quick, practical solutions by bringing together experience and technical capability.
Job Duties
Advisory Consulting currently has an opening for an entry level structural integrity engineer. The work includes developing structural inspection plans for fixed and floating offshore systems, conducting structural analysis and assessment for fixed and floating offshore structures, developing repair designs (above water and underwater repairs) as well as supporting these efforts, as required. It is a very good position to learn offshore integrity management with regards to the analytical work and the practical application. As part of the team, the engineer will work side-by-side with senior engineering staff conducting calculations and analysis. The engineer will also be expected to interface with clients during projects as well as assist in the development of written engineering reports. Some travel (domestic and international) to the offshore facilities may be required for this position.
Job Skills
The candidates’ education must be a B.S. Civil, Mechanical or Ocean Engineering minimum. Any engineering work experience is considered a plus. The candidates skill set must include the following:
General knowledge of structures, solid mechanics and structural analysis applications
Solid computer skills that include
Strong knowledge and experience with Excel, Word and Power Point
Any experience with engineering software packages such as AUTOCAD, MathCAD, Matlab and/or finite element structural packages (e.g., ANSYS, ABAQUS, SESAM, SACS, STAAD, etc.) would be considered a plus.
Good communication skills that include
Ability to develop written reports and power point presentations
Ability to present calculation and analysis results orally
Academic and work experiences that indicate
Ability to take on and solve a wide variety of challenging engineering problems
Good interpersonal skills (i.e., able to work as member of a close-knit engineering team)
Other related skills that would be considered a plus
Knowledge on structural analysis and design of offshore structures
Knowledge on risk assessment techniques
Knowledge on structural reliability techniques
In compliance with the U.S. federal government’s vaccine mandate, only candidates who are fully vaccinated for COVID-19 or have a reasonable accommodation or approved medical exception will be considered for this position.
KBR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

Title: Structural Engineer (Entry Level)
Job Description:
Company Description

At Coffman Engineers, we serve as both prime consultant and sub consultant on projects large and small, including commercial, retail, institutional, government, industrial, and project/construction management. Incorporated in 1979, we have employees in more than 20 locations serving clients across the United States and overseas.

To meet client objectives and to integrate our many disciplines, we can create teams comprised of civil, structural, mechanical, electrical, fire protection, and corrosion control, as well as project/construction managers and professionals in a variety of specialty services. This ability has made us a leader in the engineering and construction communities, and has strengthened our reputation as being progressive, innovative, and a great place to work.

Job Description

The right team is more than an advantage, it’s a game changer! Come work with a team of engineering professionals dedicated to excellence at Coffman Engineers’ San Diego location.
We are seeking an entry-level Structural Engineer with an interest in pursuing the design of commercial, institutional, and industrial structures for our San Diego office. The successful candidate will be enthusiastic, have a desire to work and grow with a multidiscipline engineering team, and be willing to have fun.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Work semi-independently.
Assist in managing CAD and production efforts.
Perform other duties as may be assigned.
Perform structural analysis and design of structural members such as beams, columns, walls, joists, and foundations.
Develop structural models that mathematically define and idealize the actual structure being designed.
Use approved codes and standards to define structural demands on buildings due to wind and seismic loadings.
Analyze and design connections of the various structural elements in a building structure.
Perform analysis needed to evaluate seismic risk in existing buildings using approved structural codes and standards.

Qualifications

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE
A four-year degree in Structural Engineering or a related field
Master’s Degree in Structural Engineering (preferred)
Registration as an E.I.T
Internship in the structural design of buildings or similar structures (preferred)
Experience with computer analysis software systems
Excellent leadership, supervisory, and writing and verbal communication skills
Being comfortable consulting to architectural practices
Working as part of a multi-discipline design team
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES
Able to multi-task and prioritize in a fast-paced environment (or demonstrate ability to develop such abilities).
Possess strong critical thinking, organizational, and analytical abilities (or demonstrate ability to develop such abilities).
Able to maintain positive working relationships with internal and external customers.
Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills.
Proficiency in Microsoft Outlook, Word and Excel preferred.
Able to work independently as well as on teams.
Positive contributor to overall office and department goals, culture, and morale.
Expected Salary Range $72,000.00 - $82,000.00.
This position is not eligible for sponsorship.

Additional Information

COVID-19 Vaccine Mandates
At this time, Coffman Engineers is subject to various state and client COVID-19 vaccination mandates in order to work on certain projects. In addition, there are two federal mandates pending which are under review by the United States legal system. If either mandate is implemented, it would impact Coffman employees.
Therefore, we will ask you about your COVID-19 vaccination status upon hire. If you choose not to be vaccinated for COVID-19, or request and are denied a medical or religious exemption, or we are unable to accommodate you even with an approved exemption, or you do not wish to inform us of your COVID-19 vaccination status, our ability to continue your employment may be impacted.
Thank you for your patience and understanding during this time of transition in our country. If you have any questions about these mandates or any other questions generated by this message, please contact the HR Representative with whom you have been working.
Why You Want to Work Here
You could choose to work anywhere, so why work at Coffman Engineers? Because we are different – our culture sets us apart. Simply stated, we are a group of creative, high-performing people who like working together and believe that what we do makes a difference. Employees say that it feels like working with a group of friends in a small office while enjoying the benefits and perks of working for a large firm. Our culture isn’t the only thing that makes us different, but it drives everything we do.
Coffman offers comprehensive benefits, including a flexible PTO program and a fun office environment. With our warm climate there are numerous things to do in San Diego; we are located near many art galleries, museums, gardens and the renowned San Diego Zoo. We welcome the dedicated and the driven to join us.
Don’t take our word for it. Check out what others are saying:
http://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Coffman-Engineers-Reviews-E409809.htm
Coffman at a Glance:
43 years in business
650+ employees serving clients throughout the U.S. and overseas from more than 20 locations
Multi-discipline engineering services plus corrosion control, commissioning and project/construction management
#27 Top 80 Engineering Firms, Building Design+Construction, 2019
#29 Zweig Group Hot Firm List, Zweig Group, 2021
#157 Top 500 Design Firms, Engineering News-Record, 2022
#1 Top Workplace (Small), The San Diego Union-Tribune, 2020
#4 Best Places to Work (Large), San Diego Business Journal, 2021
#8 “The List” for Engineering Firms, San Diego Business Journal, 2021

If you are experiencing problems applying through our system, please try again using a different browser or an updated version of your current browser. If that doesn't work, please contact us directly.

Title: Architectural/Structural Engineer

Title: 2023 Structural Engineer
Job Description:
The Aerospace Corporation is the trusted partner to the nation’s space programs, solving the hardest problems and providing unmatched technical expertise. As the operator of a federally funded research and development center (FFRDC), we are broadly engaged across all aspects of space— delivering innovative solutions that span satellite, launch, ground, and cyber systems for defense, civil and commercial customers. When you join our team, you’ll be part of a special collection of problem solvers, thought leaders, and innovators. Join us and take your place in space.
At Aerospace, we are committed to providing an inclusive and diverse workplace for all employees to share in our common passion and aspiration – to carry out a mission much bigger than ourselves.
Job Summary

The Vehicle Systems Division (VSD) sits at the center of the ideas and data behind current and future systems supplying innovative research and development; technical evaluations during the acquisition process; conceptual and detailed design; assembly, integration, and test; and operational support. Comprised primarily of highly-trained mechanical and aerospace engineers, VSD provides national expertise in the areas of vehicle engineering; guidance, navigation, and controls; robotics; electro-mechanical devices; embedded systems; fluid mechanics; propulsion; thermal control; orbital mechanics; mechanisms; structures; structural dynamics; and dynamic environments.
The Environments, Test and Assessment Department within the Structural Mechanics Subdivision, Vehicle Systems Division, is seeking a well-qualified individual with a strong foundation in solid mechanics, practical experience in structural reliability analysis using both hand calculations and finite element analysis techniques, a passion for the space industry, and a drive to apply their expertise to help solve a variety of technical challenges. The Component Analysis and Test Section has insight into the electronic components and electrical hardware being developed across the industry for the next generation of launch and space vehicles and develops technical assessments to help inform government customer decisions.
This position will be a hybrid work model and offer partially remote with some onsite work required in El Segundo, CA.
What You’ll Be Doing
Resolve design and test issues/anomalies/challenges via detailed structural analyses of electronic components and electrical hardware
Contribute to the development and execution of development, qualification, and acceptance test programs
Offer technical consultation to management, customers, contractors, and government organizations in formulating and assessing test plans, procedures, objectives, and success criteria
Maintain state-of-the-art skills in activities related to design, evaluation, and testing, including expertise in:
Structural mechanics analysis techniques
Failure modes and failure criteria
Fatigue and fracture mechanics
Nonlinear material behavior
Plasticity and viscoelasticity
Advanced finite element analysis methods
Accelerated life testing
Damage tolerance
Work within interdisciplinary teams to address cross-disciplinary issues
Communicate with both inter-organizational personnel, program offices and customers when necessary to scope, plan and resolve technical issues
Coordinate with technical experts at the contractors to address concerns
What You Need to be Successful
Minimum Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college/university program in Mechanical Engineering, Structural Engineering or related discipline (pursuing or conferred within last 12 months)
0-1 year of industry work experience
Experience performing finite element analysis with Abaqus, Nastran, Ansys or another commercial finite element software
Experience or coursework in structural mechanics such as solid mechanics, fracture mechanics, fatigue, and nonlinear materials
Experience in the design, structural analysis, and testing of hardware ( such as mechanical, dynamic, or thermal stress testing.)
Willingness to occasionally travel and to work off-business hours to support customer needs, approximately 10% (as required)
This position requires ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance, which is issued by the U.S. government. U.S. citizenship is required to obtain a security clearance.
How You Can Stand Out
It would be impressive if you have one or more of these:
Master’s degree from an accredited college/university program in Mechanical Engineering, Structural Engineering or related discipline (pursuing or conferred within last 12 months)
Experience in structural engineering or electronic/electrical hardware design
Technical proficiency in any of the following areas:
Finite Element and Energy Method theory
Mechanical properties of metals and polymers
Bonded and/or bolted joint failure criteria and analysis methodologies
Cumulative damage assessments
Coffin-Manson fatigue model
Electronic packaging failure criteria and analysis methodology
Engelmaier and Steinberg semi-empirical fatigue evaluation methods
Probabilistic analysis and uncertainty quantification
Demonstrated ability to represent the physics of structures during the analysis idealization stage, and to translate results into a conclusive assessment
Experience correlating model predictions to test results
We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. Individual salaries within that range are determined through a wide variety of factors including but not limited to education, experience, knowledge and skills.
(Min - Mid - Max)
$71,000 - $123,000 - $176,000
Pay Basis: Annual

Title: Structural Engineer
Job Description:
CAP Government, Inc. is seeking the immediate hire of an experienced and licensed Structural Engineer (with a Florida P.E. license, is highly desired). The candidate must possess the technical ability to independently work through a project from schematic design through the construction phase with minimal guidance. Our attention to detail and the quality of service we provide to clients, separates us from other firms.
Candidates will be required to prepare engineering calculations and oversight of construction documents. Coordinate structural design with architects, other engineering disciplines, building officials, and contractors. Perform construction administration functions including the review of shop drawings and interpretation of construction documents.
Duties, Responsibilities, and Qualifications
Conducts plan examining in all building permit categories of new and existing installations for compliance with the Florida Building Code; examines building projects for defects, omissions, violations, and other departures from correct procedure; provides recommendations and suggestions to contractors or owners regarding changes necessary to bring establishment up to code requirements; ensures all building construction work conforms to national and county building codes. Performs related work as required.
Evaluates proposed alternate methods and materials against code requirements.
Ability to explain the Florida Building Code and other applicable standards and/or requirements to customers, engineers, architects and field inspectors
Evaluates requests for product approvals; ascertains by field visits that manufactured products used in construction meet specifications of the original product approval.
Orders necessary shop drawings and field tests, soil reports and special supervision of construction as required to complete plans processing work.
Answers technical questions concerning the Florida Building Code for field inspectors.
Coordinates plans examining with other departments for compliance with standards and regulations.
Considerable knowledge of the engineering principles and practices of architectural and structural plans examining work.
Considerable knowledge of the Florida Building Code and all other applicable codes, standards and regulations. Knowledge of general construction methods and procedures.
Ability to read, interpret and evaluate architectural and structural details of construction plans against code requirements and good construction practices.
Ability to express ideas clearly and concisely, orally and in writing.
Ability to plan, assign and supervise the work of others in a manner conducive to full performance and high morale.
Ability to rapidly and thoroughly examine plans against codes under workload deadline conditions.
Ability to relate to architects, engineers and contractors in a professional manner.
Examines commercial and residential construction permit plans to determine structural integrity and compliance with requirements of the applicable codes and regulations.
Reviews walk-thru and drop-off residential and commercial construction plans, determines structural adequacy of various types of ratings and structures or buildings, and approves or disapproves proposed plans in accordance with code requirements.
Researches problems and complaints regarding commercial and residential work and code compliance.
Maintains high ethical, honesty and moral standards.
Perform other related duties as assigned by the Manager

Title: Entry Level Structural Engineer
Job Description:
Hello. We are GEI.
Some of the world s most pressing problems – from climate change to sustainable development, to critical infrastructure and the future of our energy supply – need our brightest and diverse minds working together to create safer, more resilient communities for tomorrow.
We are technical experts, collaborators, and entrepreneurs who draw from diverse backgrounds to solve our clients most complex challenges.
With more than 40 offices across North America, we offer a range of engineering, science, and technical consulting services. Our range of expertise, project types, and culture make us the choice for top talent in the AEC industry.
Employee-owned. Employee-focused.
As a 100% employee-owned company, our employees support our flat leadership structure, have a say in how our business operates and benefit from our financial success. We are committed to employee growth with career development opportunities, competitive total rewards, a well-being program, flexible work arrangements and more. Our company culture is driven by our 4 Cs – we are Client-Centered, Curious, Collaborative, and Community Minded – which support our focus on sustainability, safety, diversity, equity and inclusion. Get to know us better by visiting GEI s career site here.
Your role at GEI.
Job Description
The Green Bay, Wisconsin office of GEI is seeking a highly motivated entry-level engineer to perform a broad range of engineering duties to support our structural, geotechnical, and civil engineering departments.
Essential Responsibilities & Duties
Responsibilities will include assisting engineering staff in preparation of calculations and modeling of structures. Assist in drafting of design drawings. Occasional visits to construction sites that may include overnight stays.
Minimum Qualifications
Completion of BS or MS in Engineering
Good verbal and written communication skills, be team-oriented and highly self-motivated
Capable of following directions and using reference materials to pursue solutions
Possess good problem-solving skills, along with time management and organizational skills
Ability and willingness to perform field work, minor travel as needed.
Excellent computer skills, software examples include: MS Office, Autocad and/or Revit, SAP2000, STAAD, RISA, Enercalc, MathCAD
Previous engineering experience is a plus, but not required
GEI s Total Rewards Package Includes
Market-Competitive Compensation, including Eligibility for an Annual Performance Bonus
Comprehensive Benefits Program, including Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Disability and More
Well-Being Program and Paid Parental Leave
Commuter Benefits
Hybrid Work Schedules and Home Office and Cell Phone Stipends
GEI University (GEIU) with Continuing Education Assistance and Tuition Reimbursement
Connecting Conversation Program with a Focus on Professional Development and Opportunities for Advancement
Support and Financial Rewards for Publication Awards, Professional Dues, and Professional Licenses
Paid Holidays and Generous Paid Time Off Program
Rewards and Recognition
GEI-Funded Profit Sharing and 401(k)
Opportunity to be an Owner and Shareholder (Learn more here)
A Vibrant Culture that is Focused on Partnership, Sustainability, Giving Back to Our Communities and Diversity, Equity and Inclusion
And More…

Title: R&D Modeling and Simulation Engineer - PhD
Job Description:
P&G is the largest consumer packaged goods company in the world. We have operations in over 75 countries, with 65 trusted brands that improve lives for 5 billion consumers worldwide. This brings many advantages, including the opportunity for our employees to enjoy a diverse and rewarding lifelong career filled with new and exciting challenges.
Are you looking for a position that offers a rewarding lifelong career filled with new and exciting challenges? P&G is looking for an R&D Modeling and Simulation Engineer.
R&D Modeling and Simulation Engineer
This position is based out of Boston, MA (USA) location.
Important Responsibilities
Work with product researchers and designers to understand key technical challenges, help define a clear learning plan
Identify appropriate virtual analysis technique to use for the question in hand. Identify appropriate computational methods to use, execute necessary virtual methods (primarily structural analysis). If a new method is needed, define a method development plan, partner with measurement team or external vendors for experimental procedures, to validate and deploy the method.
Investigate results from an analysis to derive key insights and deliver actionable recommendation to products and process improvement.
Work closely with designers, consumer researchers, process experts, material experts and other business partners to deliver initiatives and bring to life superior products and processes.
Grow the teams’ modeling capability, efficiency, prediction confidence, and help drive model first culture across the organization.
Interface with external contractors and vendors as necessary for faster program delivery and or new capability development when needed.
Be a technical resource and offer peer assistance to internal M&S communities.

Qualifications
Ph.D. in Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Engineering Mechanics, Material Science Engineering, or equivalent field is preferred.
Candidate should have strong analytical skills with interest in applying modeling and virtual simulation methods to solve technical problems.
Have knowledge of or some exposure to computational mechanics, empirical models, numerical simulation methods such as finite element modeling (FEM) or other similar techniques are a plus but not required.
Candidates without previous modeling & simulation experience should have a strong passion to learn simulation methods and drive model first culture
Effective written and verbal communication skills are required.
Demonstrated ability to Coach, Mentor and Develop others.
Working skill level in CAD is preferred
Just So You Know:
Pay Range: $128-$140K
Compensation for roles at P&G varies depending on a wide array of non-discriminatory factors including but not limited to the specific office location, role, degree/credentials, relevant skill set, and level of relevant experience. At P&G compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. Total Rewards at P&G include salary + bonus (if applicable) + benefits. Your recruiter may be able to share more about our total rewards offerings and the specific salary range for the relevant location(s) during the hiring process.
We are committed to providing equal opportunities in employment. We value diversity and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
Immigration Sponsorship is not available for this role. For more information regarding who is eligible for hire at P&G along with other work authorization FAQ’s, please click HERE.
Procter & Gamble participates in e-verify as required by law.
Qualified individuals will not be disadvantaged based on being unemployed.
We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Boston, Massachusetts, United States Job Type: Full time Job categories: Research And Development Req No: R000064668

Title: Structural Engineer
Job Description:
SE&C is seeking qualified candidates for a Structural Engineer opportunity for our customer in Greenville, SC.
Title: Structural Engineer (including Senior and Principal Civil Engineers)
Contract Duration: Initial contract duration up to 1-year with strong potential for a longer-term assignment based on individual performance.
Location: Remote position or local in Greenville, SC.
Rate: $51-$150/hr. depending on qualifications and experience.
Close date: Once positions are filled
Clearance Required: none
JOB DESCRIPTION
Education
· Bachelor of Science in Civil / Structural Engineering
Experience
· 5+ years relevant design/field experience (Structural Engineer)
· 10+ years’ experience in design, estimating, specification preparation, construction document preparation, and related phases of engineering. (Senior Structural Engineer)
· 15+ years’ experience in design, estimating, specification preparation, construction document preparation, and related phases of engineering. (Principal Structural Engineer)
· Must have a working knowledge of Federal (including Department of Energy Orders), State, and Local codes and standards applicable to architectural design.
· Must be a US Citizen (with US Passport or Certificate of Naturalization)
Responsibilities
· Plan, organize, and coordinate structural engineering and multi-disciplined team/design projects while engaged in the planning, design, and construction phases of engineering projects.
· Prepare and review of calculations, drawings, and specifications relating to seismic and wind analyses, foundation design, structural framing analyses and design, and bracing analyses and design.
· Experience in renovating/modifying existing facilities is required.
· Familiarity with computer aided drafting applications is required.
· Conduct construction document reviews as required. (Senior Structural Engineer)
· Provide technical direction to assigned engineers (Principal Structural Engineer)
ABOUT SE&C FIELD SERVICES
Searching for your next challenge? We have employment opportunities across the country on some of the most exciting projects. Title: Structural Engineer-In-Training
Job Description:
We currently have an opportunity for a Structural Engineer-In-Training in our Denver, CO office. This position supports professional engineers as they assist our clients by providing both technical expertise and project management on a diverse range of projects.
Essential duties include:
Prepare and check structural design calculations, computer models, and drawings.
Review fabrication shop drawings for structural materials.
Collaborate with mechanical, electrical and civil engineers and architects to develop coordinated design solutions that meet project requirements.
Design structures and foundations based on design codes and standards published by International Building Code, ASCE, ACI and AISC.
Design steel structures, including framing for buildings, pipe supports, pipe racks, bridge cranes, equipment supports and access platforms. Design reinforced concrete, including concrete superstructures, slabs, walls and foundations for buildings and equipment (pumps, fans, chimneys, cooling towers, tanks, etc.); underground tunnel and vault systems; and retaining walls.
Limited travel, including visits to project sites for field coordination and to monitor construction progress.
Requirements:
Bachelors of Science degree in Civil Engineering from an ABET accredited 4-year College or University with a major emphasis in Structural Engineering.
Satisfactory grades in engineering coursework such as structural steel and reinforced concrete design, and finite element, seismic, dynamic and structural analysis.
0 to 3 years of relevant experience.
Possess EIT, or able to obtain EIT within 1 year.
Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Must be able to work in the United States for any length of time without requiring sponsorship.


Salary Range: Base Compensation: $62,000 - $70,000
In accordance with the Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act actual compensation is subject to variation due to such factors as education, experience, skillset, and/or location.

Title: Early Career Structural Engineer
Job Description:
Early Career Structural Engineer

Who We Are
At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!
This Opportunity
WSP is currently initiating a search for an Early Career Structural Engineer for our Worcester, MA office. The following locations will also be considered: Boston, MA, and Providence, RI. Be involved in projects with our Structures/Bridge Design and Inspection Team and be a part of a growing organization that meets our clients' objectives and solves their challenges.
Work with Bridge Design Teams for the rehabilitation and replacement design of bridges for various New England Transportation Agencies
Assist in the preparation of Bridge Load Ratings
Work as an Team Member on Bridge and Tunnel Inspections.
Your Impact
Assist with performing basic professional structural engineering work relating to conducting research and inspections of bridges and tunnels to satisfy federal/state inspection requirements.
Perform routine engineering functions and provide entry-level technical assistance on various design elements associated with bridge rehabilitation and replacement projects.
Assist with verifying the load carrying capacity of existing in service bridges
Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.
Perform CAD work as required to support the development of Construction Plans
Support preparation of final design plans, special provisions, and cost estimates.
Who You Are
Required Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Structural or Civil Engineering, or closely related discipline.
0 to 1 years of relevant post education experience
Excellent research skills with analytical mindset.
Familiarity with process and concepts for design/build.
Familiarity with relevant structural and civil construction laws, codes, regulations, compliance practices, and record-keeping requirements.
Competent interpersonal and communication skills when interacting with others, expressing ideas effectively and professionally to an engineering and non-engineering audience.
Proficient self-leadership with attention to detail, multi-tasking, and prioritization of responsibilities in a dynamic work environment.
Ability to work independently under general supervision, as well as part of a team to meet business objectives.
Basic proficiency with technical writing, office automation, software, spreadsheets, technology, and tools.
Familiarity with discipline-specific design software (i.e., MicroStation, AutoCAD, Civil 3D, AASHTOWare, Leap, STAAD, CSiBridge).
Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug/alcohol and harassment policies.
Ability to work schedules conducive to project-specific requirements that may extend beyond the typical workweek.
Preferred Qualifications:
Engineer in Training Certification.
Prior internship related to the degree of study and the specific engineering discipline.
A member of and/or actively participate in local professional practice organizations.
Must successfully complete and pass WSP’s Motor Vehicle screening.

#LI-MH4
Additional Requirements
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.
Additional Details
Travel Required: N/A - No travel required
Job Status: New Graduate
Employee Type: Full
Primary Location: WORCESTER - N PARKWAY
All locations: US-MA-Boston, US-MA-Worcester, US-RI-Providence
About WSP
WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com
WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.
At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. Your daily contributions to your team will be essential in meeting client objectives, goals and challenges. Are you ready to get started?
WSP USA (and all of its U.S. companies) is an Equal Opportunity Employer Race/Age/Color/Religion/Sex/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/National Origin/Disability or Protected Veteran Status.
