Proven ability to take independent, responsible chare of increasing portions of a project
Proficient in the use of computer analysis software (e.g., ETABS, RAM, etc.)
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to communicate succinctly and effectively
Detail oriented with strong interpersonal, problem solving and team building skills

Experience Education and Licensure
EIT Required, on track for PE
Experience in Mid Rise / Mixed Use, Hospitality and/or Parking Preferred
Proficiency in elevated concrete, wood and other light framing (light gauge), steel and high seismic
2+ years of experience in the structural design of concrete, steel, masonry, and wood frame structures
Bachelor’s degree Required
MS degree in Civil/Structural Engineering, Architecture, Construction Management (structural engineering preferred)

The Benefits:
Remote option with flexible work schedule
Company paid health, dental, short term, and long-term disability

Team bonding: Axe throwing, Jeopardy, Mountain Biking, Backpacking and Happy Hour!

Title: Civil/Structural/Architectural Engineer
Job Description:
Exponent is a leading engineering and scientific consulting firm that brings together more than 90 different disciplines to solve the most pressing and complicated challenges facing stakeholders today. Our vision is to engage the brightest scientists and engineers to empower clients with solutions for a safe, healthy, sustainable and technologically complex world. We leverage over 50 years of experience in analyzing accidents and failures to advise clients as they innovate their technologically complex products and processes, ensure the safety and health of their users, and address the challenges of sustainability.
We offer opportunities for you to expand your engineering or scientific knowledge amidst experts with degrees from top programs at over 500 universities. At Exponent, you will apply your experience, technical skills, and prior academic research to a fulfilling career in consulting. You will have the opportunity to develop continuously through formal and informal development programs, coaching and mentoring, and involvement in a wide array of projects. We are excited about your interest in joining our growing team!
Key statistics:
1100+ Team members
900+ Consultants
550+ Ph.D.s
30+ Offices globally
We are currently seeking a Civil/Structural/Architectural Engineer for our Buildings & Structures Practice in Atlanta, GA. In this role you will work as part of a team to conduct analytical and computer problem solving, perform experimental field investigations and diagnostic surveys, and maintain/develop client relations. Assignments will require the ability to gather information from and convey technical conclusions to individuals in engineering, business, and industry.
You will be responsible for:
Inspection, analysis, and determination of root causes of structural/building envelope performance failures
Conducting analytical and computer problem solving
Performing field investigations and diagnostic surveys
Preparing technical reports and presentations
Continued professional development towards establishing professional expertise
You will have the following skills and qualifications:
Ph.D. in Civil/Structural/Architectural Engineering is strongly preferred. MS degree in Civil/Structural/Architectural Engineering will be considered only with significant relevant work experience.
P.E., S.E., or AIA license or the ability to become licensed within three years in at least one state
Excellent creative problem-solving ability
Outstanding verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work independently as well as lead and work in multi-disciplinary teams
Ability to gather information from and convey technical conclusions to individuals in engineering, business, and industry
Applicants are encouraged to submit a CV (Curriculum Vitae) with publications (feel free to include publications that are in review or pending) [not restricted to 1 page].
To learn more about life at Exponent and our impact, please visit the following links:
https://info.exponent.com/our-impact
www.exponent.com/careers/grad-students
We value and encourage diversity, equity and inclusion across all facets of our firm. Having a team built of people with different backgrounds, skills and perspectives allows us to provide better value to our clients and enjoy an enriched work environment.
Our firm is committed to offering a variety of programs and resources to support health and well-being. We believe that providing competitive benefits as well as compensation and recognition programs empowers our staff to do work that makes a difference.
Exponent is a proud equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected status.
If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability, you may email us at HR-Accommodations@exponent.com .

Title: Structural Engineer
Job Description:
Tapani Inc. performs heavy civil, site construction, and structural concrete services as well as general contracting throughout the Pacific Northwest. With approximately 500 employees either managing projects in the field or providing support from an office or shop, we recognize that it's people who make a difference. Every position is important to the success of an organization. All our employees are valued and encouraged to grow in their careers and participate in the future of the company.
Job Purpose
Position of Structural Engineer requires thorough knowledge of civil/structural design and engineering techniques. The Structural Engineer devises new approaches to problems, and prepares or modifies drawings, specifications, calculations, charts and graphs, and monitors work for compliance to applicable codes, accepted engineering practices. Under Washington State law, Structural Engineers will need to place a Stamp on plans or any designs configured.
Responsibilities
Structural engineering calculations
Structural engineering plans, design, and layout
Work closely with supervisor to discuss goal reaching and problem solving
Structural project specifications
Supporting estimating team in regards to structural engineering portion of project cost estimates
Support project teams with the plans and working with subcontractors to ensure plan details are executed properly and on time while solving any problems
Support estimating with structural engineering portion of project proposals
Completing projects in a timely manner
Perform structural design and analysis calculations using governing codes and standards, engineering formulas, skills, and experience
Layout and details portions of projects
Maintain site presentation and stage plat planning
Research design options and document findings
Set and maintain Tapani expectations with subcontractors
Assume the lead engineer s role on assigned projects
Team building with subcontractors
May direct and supervise other Designers/Drafters activities
Coordinate work with other disciplines such as architectural, mechanical, electrical, etc
Handle routine contract administration
Commit to Tapani core cultural values
Be able to use computer-assisted engineering and design software and equipment to prepare engineering design documents
Provide daily work direction responsibilities
Partial budgetary preparation / compliance accountability
Job Requirements and Qualifications
Minimum of 4 years experience ( education, work, or both)
Must have a have completed the Fundamentals of Engineering exam (FE)
Have a Certified Engineers Stamp
Safety-onsite and classroom training
Perform the necessary math required to plan and calculate designs and layouts
Interpersonal skills
Software interface-onsite
Team builder
Some experience with training and supervising
Communication skills both written and verbal
Self starter
Problem solver and decision making
Performs tasks with moderate supervision
Ability to perform job duties which may include but not limited to lifting and carrying 30 pounds, standing and walking for long periods of time. Listening, hearing, talking and sitting.
Working Environment
Hours are typically Monday - Friday 7 a.m. - 5 p.m. and may vary due to specific job sites and meetings
Wide diversity of work situations includes office and field work
Onsite daily, occasional meetings and training off site
Compensation and Benefits
Salary: $97,777.00 - $146,665.00 per year (based on qualifications and experience)
Monthly $700 truck allowance and $75 phone allowance or company phone
Comprehensive Medical Insurance plans with low to $0 monthly premiums
Additional voluntary insurance options include: Dental, Vision, and a wide variety of Supplemental insurances.
Flexible Paid Time Off and Sick Time
Company Paid Life Insurance
401(k) options with up to 4% employer match

Title: Associate Multidiscipline Engineer
Job Description:
At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.
Airframe Customer Support Engineering is seeking multiple Associate Multidiscipline Engineers to join our team and make an immediate impact on both urgent and long-term fleet support in Seal Beach, California.

You will be able to combine the deep expertise and resources of the entire Boeing enterprise with the flexibility and fast pace of a small company setting. You will have opportunities to collaborate with people from all over the world to create and deliver innovative solutions to complex technical problems, and to learn how to develop a full structural repair and return an airplane to service in as little as 4 hours.
Boeing Customer Support operates on a 24/7/365 basis.
Some non-standard shifts, (nights/weekends/holidays) are available to interested candidates and/or may be required on a rotational basis, if needed to support our fleet. All positions require a willingness to work flexible schedules and shifts.
This position allows limited telecommuting. The selected candidate will be required to perform 4 days of work onsite with the option of working virtually on Fridays.
Travel:
Occasional travel (10%) may be required in support of the program and customers, as well as to enhance your career through learning experiences.

Position Responsibilities:
Performs structural analysis to determine structural integrity (margins of safety), using classical techniques and Boeing tools.
Develops structural math models and performs analysis, using finite element methods, to develop internal loads and stresses.
Creates strength check notes in support of document analysis.
Assists in the development of in-house tools to enable efficient performance of engineering tasks.
Resolving structural issues to help return airplanes into service.
Developing and analyzing repairs to be published in the Structural Repair Manual or Service Bulletins.
Perform detailed investigations and analyses to preclude safety issues.
Performing damage tolerance evaluations and crack growth analyses to determine airplane inspection requirements.
Communicate with External Customers
This position must meet export control compliance requirements. To meet export control compliance requirements, a “U.S. Person” as defined by 22 C.F.R. §120.15 is required. “U.S. Person” includes U.S. Citizen, lawful permanent resident, refugee, or asylee.
Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):
Bachelor's degree or higher from an accredited course of study in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics or chemistry.
2+ years of experience working with or on an engineering team.
Must be willing to be on call 24x7 as required to support emergent airline customer requirements.
Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience):
Experience with Transport, Boeing 7-Series or McDonnell Douglas Aircraft is a plus.
Master of Science in Mechanical, Civil or Aerospace engineering preferred.
Experience using excellent verbal and written communication skills to communicate with leaders, colleagues and customers in an engineering environment.
Education/ Experience:
Education/experience typically acquired through advanced technical education from an accredited course of study in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics or chemistry (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 2 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of technical education and experience (e.g. Master). In the USA, ABET accreditation is the preferred, although not required, accreditation standard.
Relocation:
This position offers relocation based on candidate eligibility.
Drug Free Workplace:
Boeing is a Drug Free Workplace where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies.

Shift:
This position is for variable shifts.
“At Boeing, we strive to deliver a Total Rewards package that will attract, engage and retain the top talent. Elements of the Total Rewards package include competitive base pay and variable compensation opportunities.
The Boeing Company also provides eligible employees with an opportunity to enroll in a variety of benefit programs, generally including health insurance, flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance programs, and a number of programs that provide for both paid and unpaid time away from work.
The specific programs and options available to any given employee may vary depending on eligibility factors such as geographic location, date of hire, and the applicability of collective bargaining agreements.

Title: Structural Engineer II
Job Description:
Structural Engineers Exist in the Movie and Entertainment Industry…..
This is for a Structural Engineer I or II - 0 to 4 years experience
We are looking for an energetic and motivated Structural Engineer to join our Southern California Team. Our scope of work covers structural engineering consulting in the entertainment/museum installation industry. Our structures and clientele almost exclusively live in the temporary structure world; however, our museum and architecture clients do permanent installations as well.
Please note, this is very much a structural engineering position, however, we do not design permanent buildings or bridge structures. If you want to fly Rihanna during Superbowl, this is the place, if you want to design the stadium, we suggest employment elsewhere.
The ideal candidate should have a good understanding of structural design and analyses, but also be able to perform rational based engineering, using engineering theory, to solve structural problems. Not all materials used in architectural and entertainment installations are governed by a direct code. A strong background in hands-on activities is a plus. Most of our clients are not engineers, so a strong understanding of principles and good communication skills are essential.
We are a very hard-working team, but we do not spend all of our time with our noses in our books. This job requires mostly working from home, as such, we have a good system of communication to stay involved through the day. If you think you qualify, sit through an informal meet and greet with our hiring manager to learn more and see if you fit.
About this Position:
This position is for our Boston Area position. This is an entry to mid-level position and requires some office time near Worcester, MA. Our East Coast Manager is an hour from Boston. A requirement for this position is site visits for local movie locations and inspections of events. Out of state travel is some what common but will only be required/offered after training. You will be compensated generously for mileage and all fees are expendable. Site visits are project dependent and are not constant. There will be busy times, and slow times. Approximately 15-25% of time is spent in the field.
Desired Skill-Sets:
Strong knowledge of structural design principles and building codes.
Ability to perform structural analysis and design for a variety of structural systems and materials. Not all materials used in the architectural/show world fall into the four basic structural materials. It is our job, as engineers, to understand the materials they have and use rational approaches for safe solutions. Not all materials have codes.
Ability to prepare clear and concise technical reports and design documents not just for engineers, but often for non-engineers.
Good communication skills, including the ability to effectively communicate design concepts and requirements to clients, contractors, and other stakeholders.
Willingness to continually update skills and knowledge in the field of structural engineering.
On-site Inspections as required for structural design or structural safety considerations.
Desired Qualifications:
Bachelor or Masters in Civil / Structural Engineering
Good Communication Skills (both verbal and written)
Licensed PE or willingness to get your PE license (EIT Minimum Please)
Experience with RISA 3D, AutoCAD, & Microsoft Excel (or similar types of programs)
Experience with building codes (IBC, AISC, ADM, ACI, NDS)
Additional Benefits:
Cell Phone Stipend
Internet Stipend
Work from home and work in the field
Paid hourly and not a flat salary – “If you do the time you get the dime” – The more work you do, the more you get paid.
Competitive Bonus and Pay
The Fun Stuff:
Multiple SoCal company outings per year – Our managing owner loves to BBQ.
Flexible work schedule. We provide a work hard/play hard mentality where we allow for engineers to have flexible work schedules to deal with life. We do expect deadlines are met in the process, but taking time to go camping, see your kids soccer game or just have a long lunch with the family is encouraged and at times required.

Title: Design Engineer, Early Career, Optical and Mechanical Systems
Location: Welch Mechanical Designs, LLC in Aberdeen, MD 21001
Job Description:
About us:
WMD is an established small business specializing in the design and manufacture of ultraprecision optical instruments to support a broad range of scientific research around the world and in space. The work is challenging and requires our team members to be able to balance technical, environmental, business, cost, usability, manufacturability, and a myriad of other requirements while creating novel solutions to our customer’s needs. A core competency of our team is the ability to create designs that require no prototypes and that work reliably for years, sometimes decades in their very first incarnation. This may sound daunting, but we have evolved a very supportive and collaborative culture that allows all team members access to the skills, feedback and support of the rest of the company. While we place a high value on technical skills, we also value the individuality and unique experiences and needs of all our team members. Striving for work life balance, care for each other’s well-being and frequently checking in to make sure team members feel supported and valued is a key part of our success and contentment as a team.
About you:
You are passionate about designing, analyzing, creating and understanding every aspect of whatever you work on. You strive to not only understand what works, but WHY it works down to basic physics and how to make it work better. You are pragmatic and able to compromise to achieve a well-balanced design because there are always conflicting requirements. You prefer working from a strong set of basic guiding principles rather than an infinite list of rigid procedures. You are flexible and able to pivot when problems and conflicts arise. You are thorough and work hard to understand your work deeply to create the most effective designs possible. You are emotionally intelligent and patient with yourself, coworkers, and customers because you realize we are all learning and doing the best we can. You strive to always do better in your technical work and your interpersonal interactions. You value growth in yourself and your teammates and strive to lift everyone up.
Benefits:
We offer industry competitive pay plus an amazing package of additional benefits!
· Health insurance with 80% of the premium paid by the company
· 401k with automatic 3% safe harbor contribution without matching requirements
· Tuition assistance for university and short courses
· Charitable donation matching and partial compensation for volunteering in the community
· Flexible work schedules
· 10 paid holidays including the week between Christmas and New Years annual shut down
· Paid Time Off
· Work from home as time and productivity allows
· High efficiency vehicle credits
· Paid time to vote and to volunteer
Job Description:
The Mechanical Design Engineer collects and digests requirements to create 3D CAD models and 2D toleranced manufacturing drawings of mechanical assemblies. You will have opportunities to work on exciting projects like:
· Optics for high-powered lasers
· Scientific and tactical instruments such as LiDARS for atmospheric sensing and target ranging and multi- and hyperspectral imaging cameras
· Ultra-Precision Parts Manufacturing to support research labs
· Diamond Turning Machining to nanometer tolerances
· Telescopes for use in challenging environments like space and aircraft
· Air-borne instrumentation for NASA & Military customers
Responsibilities and Duties:
· Create detailed multi-view hand sketches of products prior to starting work in CAD software – computers are amazing when you need precision and the ability to edit a design. But nothing beats the speed and efficiency of pencil, paper and hand sketching during the rapid concept development phase. Artistic skills have been very helpful for other team members so embrace your artistic side!
· Use 3D CAD software (PTC CREO) to develop designs and manufacturing drawings from concept sketches
· Review yours and teammates’ designs for compliance with engineering principles, company standards, customer contract requirements, and related specifications
· Perform hand and FEA structural analysis of designs as needed and use results to optimize designs for mass, stiffness, strength, vibration modes, etc
· Perform preliminary and advanced development for new proposals and concepts
· Perform assembly of designs after parts are machined
· Perform detailed inspections of parts using various inspection equipment including CMM – training provided
· Operate high precision manufacturing equipment as required - training provided
Education and Experience:
· Minimum Bachelor's degree (B.S.) in mechanical, aerospace or manufacturing engineering
· Experience with PTC CREO CAD software desired
· Experience with machining, precision instruments, optics a plus
· Experience designing and building things – usually in college or extracurricular hobbies for junior candidates
- A portfolio showing samples of past designs and drawings is very helpful. No proprietary materials please.
Competencies and Qualifications:
· Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of variables in situations where only limited standardization exists
· Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, verbal and other forms
· Ability to read, understand and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, procedure manuals, 2D manufacturing drawings with geometric dimensioning and tolerancing (GD&T), government regulations and standards and customer contract requirements and statements of work
· Ability to work with minimal supervision and capable of self-checking for completeness and accuracy of work produced
· Ability to take initiative and able to contribute in design reviews
· Skilled in PC usage, office applications, and basic computer networking understanding
· Ability to learn new software easily is a plus
· Good manual dexterity and familiarity with assembly of small parts
· Familiar with proper assembly procedures for precision instruments and able to assist with assembly of developed designs
· Ability to lift 40 pounds on limited basis, less than 20 pounds regularly
Miscellaneous Items:
All candidates must be a US citizen.
Please do not contact company directly. All inquiries must come through this site..

Title: Structural Engineer
Job Description:
Tapani Inc. performs heavy civil, site construction, and structural concrete services as well as general contracting throughout the Pacific Northwest. With approximately 500 employees either managing projects in the field or providing support from an office or shop, we recognize that it's people who make a difference. Every position is important to the success of an organization. All our employees are valued and encouraged to grow in their careers and participate in the future of the company.
Job Purpose
Position of Structural Engineer requires thorough knowledge of civil/structural design and engineering techniques. The Structural Engineer devises new approaches to problems, and prepares or modifies drawings, specifications, calculations, charts and graphs, and monitors work for compliance to applicable codes, accepted engineering practices. Under Washington State law, Structural Engineers will need to place a Stamp on plans or any designs configured.
Responsibilities
Structural engineering calculations
Structural engineering plans, design, and layout
Work closely with supervisor to discuss goal reaching and problem solving
Structural project specifications
Supporting estimating team in regards to structural engineering portion of project cost estimates
Support project teams with the plans and working with subcontractors to ensure plan details are executed properly and on time while solving any problems
Support estimating with structural engineering portion of project proposals
Completing projects in a timely manner
Perform structural design and analysis calculations using governing codes and standards, engineering formulas, skills, and experience
Layout and details portions of projects
Maintain site presentation and stage plat planning
Research design options and document findings
Set and maintain Tapani expectations with subcontractors
Assume the lead engineer s role on assigned projects
Team building with subcontractors
May direct and supervise other Designers/Drafters activities
Coordinate work with other disciplines such as architectural, mechanical, electrical, etc
Handle routine contract administration
Commit to Tapani core cultural values
Be able to use computer-assisted engineering and design software and equipment to prepare engineering design documents
Provide daily work direction responsibilities
Partial budgetary preparation / compliance accountability
Job Requirements and Qualifications
Minimum of 4 years experience ( education, work, or both)
Must have a have completed the Fundamentals of Engineering exam (FE)
Have a Certified Engineers Stamp
Safety-onsite and classroom training
Perform the necessary math required to plan and calculate designs and layouts
Interpersonal skills
Software interface-onsite
Team builder
Some experience with training and supervising
Communication skills both written and verbal
Self starter
Problem solver and decision making
Performs tasks with moderate supervision
Ability to perform job duties which may include but not limited to lifting and carrying 30 pounds, standing and walking for long periods of time. Listening, hearing, talking and sitting.
Working Environment
Hours are typically Monday - Friday 7 a.m. - 5 p.m. and may vary due to specific job sites and meetings
Wide diversity of work situations includes office and field work
Onsite daily, occasional meetings and training off site
Compensation and Benefits
Salary: $97,777.00 - $146,665.00 per year (based on qualifications and experience)
Monthly $700 truck allowance and $75 phone allowance or company phone
Comprehensive Medical Insurance plans with low to $0 monthly premiums
Additional voluntary insurance options include: Dental, Vision, and a wide variety of Supplemental insurances.
Flexible Paid Time Off and Sick Time
Company Paid Life Insurance
401(k) options with up to 4% employer match

Title: Associate Multidiscipline Engineer
Job Description:
At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.
Airframe Customer Support Engineering is seeking multiple Associate Multidiscipline Engineers to join our team and make an immediate impact on both urgent and long-term fleet support in Seal Beach, California.

You will be able to combine the deep expertise and resources of the entire Boeing enterprise with the flexibility and fast pace of a small company setting. You will have opportunities to collaborate with people from all over the world to create and deliver innovative solutions to complex technical problems, and to learn how to develop a full structural repair and return an airplane to service in as little as 4 hours.
Boeing Customer Support operates on a 24/7/365 basis.
Some non-standard shifts, (nights/weekends/holidays) are available to interested candidates and/or may be required on a rotational basis, if needed to support our fleet. All positions require a willingness to work flexible schedules and shifts.
This position allows limited telecommuting. The selected candidate will be required to perform 4 days of work onsite with the option of working virtually on Fridays.
Travel:
Occasional travel (10%) may be required in support of the program and customers, as well as to enhance your career through learning experiences.

Position Responsibilities:
Performs structural analysis to determine structural integrity (margins of safety), using classical techniques and Boeing tools.
Develops structural math models and performs analysis, using finite element methods, to develop internal loads and stresses.
Creates strength check notes in support of document analysis.
Assists in the development of in-house tools to enable efficient performance of engineering tasks.
Resolving structural issues to help return airplanes into service.
Developing and analyzing repairs to be published in the Structural Repair Manual or Service Bulletins.
Perform detailed investigations and analyses to preclude safety issues.
Performing damage tolerance evaluations and crack growth analyses to determine airplane inspection requirements.
Communicate with External Customers
This position must meet export control compliance requirements. To meet export control compliance requirements, a “U.S. Person” as defined by 22 C.F.R. §120.15 is required. “U.S. Person” includes U.S. Citizen, lawful permanent resident, refugee, or asylee.
Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):
Bachelor's degree or higher from an accredited course of study in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics or chemistry.
2+ years of experience working with or on an engineering team.
Must be willing to be on call 24x7 as required to support emergent airline customer requirements.
Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience):
Experience with Transport, Boeing 7-Series or McDonnell Douglas Aircraft is a plus.
Master of Science in Mechanical, Civil or Aerospace engineering preferred.
Experience using excellent verbal and written communication skills to communicate with leaders, colleagues and customers in an engineering environment.
Education/ Experience:
Education/experience typically acquired through advanced technical education from an accredited course of study in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics or chemistry (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 2 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of technical education and experience (e.g. Master). In the USA, ABET accreditation is the preferred, although not required, accreditation standard.
Relocation:
This position offers relocation based on candidate eligibility.
Drug Free Workplace:
Boeing is a Drug Free Workplace where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies.

Shift:
This position is for variable shifts.
“At Boeing, we strive to deliver a Total Rewards package that will attract, engage and retain the top talent. Elements of the Total Rewards package include competitive base pay and variable compensation opportunities.
The Boeing Company also provides eligible employees with an opportunity to enroll in a variety of benefit programs, generally including health insurance, flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance programs, and a number of programs that provide for both paid and unpaid time away from work.
The specific programs and options available to any given employee may vary depending on eligibility factors such as geographic location, date of hire, and the applicability of collective bargaining agreements.
Please note that the salary information shown below is a general guideline only. Salaries are based upon candidate experience and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations.
Summary Pay Range: $79,050 - $106,950

Equal Opportunity Employer:
Boeing is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military/veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Title: Structural Engineer II
Job Description:
Structural Engineers Exist in the Movie and Entertainment Industry…..
This is for a Structural Engineer I or II - 0 to 4 years experience
We are looking for an energetic and motivated Structural Engineer to join our Southern California Team. Our scope of work covers structural engineering consulting in the entertainment/museum installation industry. Our structures and clientele almost exclusively live in the temporary structure world; however, our museum and architecture clients do permanent installations as well.
Please note, this is very much a structural engineering position, however, we do not design permanent buildings or bridge structures. If you want to fly Rihanna during Superbowl, this is the place, if you want to design the stadium, we suggest employment elsewhere.
The ideal candidate should have a good understanding of structural design and analyses, but also be able to perform rational based engineering, using engineering theory, to solve structural problems. Not all materials used in architectural and entertainment installations are governed by a direct code. A strong background in hands-on activities is a plus. Most of our clients are not engineers, so a strong understanding of principles and good communication skills are essential.
We are a very hard-working team, but we do not spend all of our time with our noses in our books. This job requires mostly working from home, as such, we have a good system of communication to stay involved through the day. If you think you qualify, sit through an informal meet and greet with our hiring manager to learn more and see if you fit.
About this Position:
This position is for our Boston Area position. This is an entry to mid-level position and requires some office time near Worcester, MA. Our East Coast Manager is an hour from Boston. A requirement for this position is site visits for local movie locations and inspections of events. Out of state travel is some what common but will only be required/offered after training. You will be compensated generously for mileage and all fees are expendable. Site visits are project dependent and are not constant. There will be busy times, and slow times. Approximately 15-25% of time is spent in the field.
Desired Skill-Sets:
Strong knowledge of structural design principles and building codes.
Ability to perform structural analysis and design for a variety of structural systems and materials. Not all materials used in the architectural/show world fall into the four basic structural materials. It is our job, as engineers, to understand the materials they have and use rational approaches for safe solutions. Not all materials have codes.
Ability to prepare clear and concise technical reports and design documents not just for engineers, but often for non-engineers.
Good communication skills, including the ability to effectively communicate design concepts and requirements to clients, contractors, and other stakeholders.
Willingness to continually update skills and knowledge in the field of structural engineering.
On-site Inspections as required for structural design or structural safety considerations.
Desired Qualifications:
Bachelor or Masters in Civil / Structural Engineering
Good Communication Skills (both verbal and written)
Licensed PE or willingness to get your PE license (EIT Minimum Please)
Experience with RISA 3D, AutoCAD, & Microsoft Excel (or similar types of programs)
Experience with building codes (IBC, AISC, ADM, ACI, NDS)
Additional Benefits:
Cell Phone Stipend
Internet Stipend
Work from home and work in the field
Paid hourly and not a flat salary – “If you do the time you get the dime” – The more work you do, the more you get paid.
Competitive Bonus and Pay
The Fun Stuff:
Multiple SoCal company outings per year – Our managing owner loves to BBQ.
Flexible work schedule. We provide a work hard/play hard mentality where we allow for engineers to have flexible work schedules to deal with life. We do expect deadlines are met in the process, but taking time to go camping, see your kids soccer game or just have a long lunch with the family is encouraged and at times required.

Title: Structural Engineer I
Job Description:
Overview:
Stellar is seeking a full-time Structural Engineer I to join our team. You will be responsible for the analysis and design of structural elements for industrial and food processing facilities. You should be a team player and committed to the quality of work generated.
Responsibilities:
Applications include foundations, mat slab, structural steel framing, tilt-up walls, precast concrete structures, concrete design, masonry walls, wood design and light-gauge metal framing
Prepare contract documents, calculations, field observation reports, and estimates
Utilization of AutoCAD, Revit, RAM Structural System, RISA 3D, SP Mat, Enercalc and Excel
Qualifications:
1-3 years of professional experience
Bachelor’s degree in Civil/Structural Engineering required
Possess excellent working knowledge of building codes and standards such as IBC, FBC, ASCE-7, AISC, ACI preferred
10% travel required

About Stellar
Stellar offers a comprehensive package which includes:
Competitive pay based on experience
Remote & hybrid work options for many positions
Paid Time Off – accrue 15 days (120 hours) within first year of service
Paid holidays
Medical, dental, and vision insurance options
Tax-advantaged accounts (HSA, FSA, Dependent Care FSA)
Company-paid life and disability insurance

Stellar, headquartered in Jacksonville, FL, is a fully integrated firm focusing on design, construction, architecture, engineering, and mechanical services worldwide for over 30 years. Stellar combines a multitude of capabilities to create buildings and systems of exceptional long-term quality, value and efficiency. From food processing plants and healthcare facilities to refrigerated warehouses, automated production lines and beyond, we offer an integrated approach to meet all our clients’ needs.

Title: Structural Analysis Engineer - Primary Structures, Structural Integrity and Analysis
Structural Application Engineer
Job Description:
Application Engineer
Do you like a challenge, are you a complex thinker who likes to solve problems? If so, then you might be the new Altairian we are searching for. At Altair, your curiosity matters. We pride ourselves on a business culture that enables open, creative thinking, and we deeply value our employees and their contributions towards our clients' success, as well as our own.
Job Summary:
The Application Engineer will serve as the primary technical consultant responsible for actively driving and managing the technical evaluation and application of the simulation suite of products with Altair’s Aerospace customers and prospects.
What You Will Do:
Mainly work with Altair Aerospace Industry customers and prospects.
Design and conduct Altair product presentations and demonstrations, which include but are not limited to question-and-answer discussions with the customer and partner’s technical staff.
Visit on-site with customers to perform technical analysis and qualification of potential customer projects.
Discuss the potential sales opportunities with the sales team.
Maintain contact with prospects, customers, and partners. Discuss current and new-release product features and uses.
Propose Altair’s Support Services and Consulting Services to customers who need assistance to resolve challenging problems and build solutions of demanding complexity.
Proactively contact prospects and customers in conjunction with Account Management business planning.
Manage customer expectations so as to ensure maximum satisfaction with Altair’s products and services.
Liaison between customers and development personnel to drive new feature requests into future product releases.
Interface with and provide assistance to Altair’s customer support organization with their efforts to assist customers with resolving customer support issues.
What You Will Need:
Basics:
U.S. person required due to Government Contracts.
Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering or related required. A Master’s degree is a plus.
Knowledge and strong interest in Finite Element Analysis (FEA)
1-3 years of hands-on FEA experience preferred.
Good communication skills (Oral and Written).
Energetic.
Strong interpersonal skills.
Ability to collaborate with all levels of technical users and management.
Excellent presentation skills.
Aptitude for solving engineering problems.
Willingness to travel throughout the region as required
How You Will Be Successful:
Envision the Future
Communicate Honestly and Broadly
Seek Technology and Business “Firsts”
Embrace Diversity and Take Risks

Flex Time
Competitive Salary
Comprehensive Benefit Package
Employee Stock Purchase Program

Collaborative environment

Why Work with Us:
Altair is a global technology company providing software and cloud solutions in the areas of product development, high-performance computing (HPC) and artificial intelligence (AI). Altair enables organizations in nearly every industry to compete more effectively in a connected world, while creating a more sustainable future. With more than 3,000 engineers, scientists, and creative thinkers in 25 countries, we help solve our customer’s toughest challenges and deliver unparalleled service, helping the innovators innovate, drive better decisions, and turn today’s problems into tomorrow’s opportunities.
Our vision is to transform customer decision making with data analytics, simulation, and high-performance computing and artificial intelligence (AI).
For more than 30 years, we have been helping our customers integrate electronics and controls with mechanical design to expand product value, develop AI, simulation, and data-driven digital twins to drive better decisions, and deliver advanced HPC and cloud solutions to support unlimited idea exploration. To learn more, please visit altair.com.
Ready to go? #ONLYFORWARD
At our core we are explorers; adventurers; pioneers. We are the brains behind some of the world’s most revolutionary innovations and are not only comfortable in new and uncharted waters, we dive in headfirst. We are the original trailblazers that make the impossible possible, discovering new solutions to our customer’s toughest challenges.
Altair is an equal opportunity employer. Our backgrounds are diverse, and every member of our global team is critical to our success. Altair's history demonstrates a belief that empowering each individual authentic voice reinforces a culture that thrives because of the uniqueness among our team.

Title: Structural - Senior Engineer/Associate
Job Description:
Exponent is a leading engineering and scientific consulting firm that brings together more than 90 different disciplines to solve the most pressing and complicated challenges facing stakeholders today. Our vision is to engage the brightest scientists and engineers to empower clients with solutions for a safe, healthy, sustainable and technologically complex world. We leverage over 50 years of experience in analyzing accidents and failures to advise clients as they innovate their technologically complex products and processes, ensure the safety and health of their users, and address the challenges of sustainability.
We offer opportunities for you to expand your engineering or scientific knowledge amidst experts from top programs at over 500 universities. At Exponent, you will apply your experience, technical skills, and prior academic research to a fulfilling career in consulting. You will have the opportunity to develop continuously through formal and informal development programs, coaching and mentoring, and involvement in a wide array of projects. We are excited about your interest in joining our growing team!
Key statistics:
1100+ Team members
900+ Consultants
550+ Ph.D.s
30+ Offices globally
We are currently seeking a Structural - Senior Engineer/Associate for our Buildings & Structures Practice in New York, NY. In this role you will work as part of a team conducting analytical and computer problem solving, performing experimental field investigations and diagnostic surveys, and maintaining client relations.
You will be responsible for:
Inspection, analysis and determination of root causes of structural performance failures
Development of risk mitigation strategies for structures and continued professional development towards establishing professional expertise
Assignments will require the ability to gather information from and convey technical conclusions to individuals in engineering, business, and industry
You will have the following skills and qualifications:
Ph.D. in Structural Engineering or MS degree in Structural Engineering with significant relevant work experience
P.E. or S.E. license or the ability to become licensed in the State of New York
Excellent creative problem-solving ability
Outstanding verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work independently as well as lead and work in multi-disciplinary teams
Strong desire to meet deadlines in a fast-paced and exciting consulting environment
To learn more about life at Exponent and our impact, please visit the following links:
https://info.exponent.com/our-impact
www.exponent.com/careers/grad-students
We value and encourage diversity, equity and inclusion across all facets of our firm. Having a team built of people with different backgrounds, skills and perspectives allows us to provide better value to our clients and enjoy an enriched work environment.
Our firm is committed to offering a variety of programs and resources to support health and well-being. We believe that providing competitive benefits as well as compensation and recognition programs empowers our staff to do work that makes a difference.
Compensation
Our consultants are rewarded for their technical and business contributions and have an opportunity to plan for future success and career growth. Exponent's total compensation plan is consistent with its expectations of the quality and quantity of work performed and with the professional standards set by Exponent. At the Associate and Senior Associate level total compensation includes base salary, bi-weekly bonuses for high intensity efforts, annual bonus and 401(k) employer contribution of 7% of base salary.
The base salary range for this position is $120,000 - $135,000 depending on experience and capabilities which will be assessed during the interview process.
Benefits
Access benefits information at this link.
Exponent is a proud equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected status.
If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability, you may email us at HR-Accommodations@exponent.com.

Title: Field Managing Engineer - Civil Structural
Job Description:
Keystone Experts & Engineers has been recognized by the INC. 5000 for three years running as one of the fastest growing, privately held companies in the US. Our energetic, dedicated team is focused on providing exceptional service to clients across the country. With a nationwide reach, Keystone has built a highly skilled national team of multi-disciplined engineers, architects, fire investigators, contractors and industry experts; giving us the ability to handle the day-to-day volume of projects, as well as the capacity to scale up to meet the needs of our clients.
Have we piqued your interest yet? If you answered yes, then keep reading!
We are seeking a full-time Field/Managing Engineer (Civil/Structural), location is flexible. In this position, your primary responsibilities will include completing residential & commercial forensic investigations involving flood, wind, hail, foundation issues, roof damage, water intrusion & building envelope claims, technical review of field work across the country, including guidance for field engineers (FEs) and technical writers (TWs), ensuring reports meet or exceed Keystone standards and guidelines, and the clients’ key questions are answered accurately and clearly.
If you value a flexible work schedule, dynamic projects, and technology and tools that make your job more efficient, then you’ve come to the right place.
What you will do in the field:
Conduct investigations of accidents or disasters to determine causes and contributing factors.
Evaluate structural or water damage caused by natural disasters such as earthquakes, hurricanes, wind events, hail storms or floods.
Ensure proper maintenance & construction of affected building components & systems.
Safely access roofs, attics & crawl spaces to photo document areas of interest.
Identify and interview witnesses and/or other key parties involved.
Prepare & submit findings and recommendations that can be used to resolve insurance claims or litigation matters.
What you will do as a manager:
Perform technical review of reports for quality assurance, technical accuracy, and consistency.
Assignment budget and scope development.
Qualify, educate, and train FEs and TWs.
Develop and implement procedures and methods for forensic inspections and reports, ensuring Keystone’s quality standards are met and maintained.
Provide expert analysis to our clients on an array of forensic engineering assignments involving flood, wind, hail, foundation issues, roof damage, water intrusion and building envelope issues, as well as structural or water damage, among others.
Periodic travel to train FEs, attend technical or business development conferences, perform investigative oversight on an as-needed basis.
Client interaction, training, and education.
Take all reasonable steps necessary to improve turnaround times while maintaining or improving the quality of reports.
What you will bring:
Degree in civil or structural engineering, or similar field.
Active Professional Engineering license and a willingness to obtain additional licenses in other states.
10+ years of forensic engineering experience in the insurance claim industry.
Experience managing engineers is a plus.
Outstanding written and verbal communications skills.
An analytical mind and strong problem-solving ability.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and adhere to tight deadlines.
Well-versed in building materials, codes, construction methods, and common modes of failure.
Tech-savvy across multiple software platforms, tools, equipment, and investigative techniques.
Innovative ideas and the ability to effectively communicate new ideas to improve operational and technical procedures and methods.
Compensation:
$130K base, plus best in industry production-based quarterly incentive bonuses
Benefits:

Refuse to lose
Keystone provides a culture where everyone can grow. So, no matter who you are or where you’re coming from, please apply if this is a role that would make you excited to come to work every day!

Title: Entry Level Structural Engineer P1
Job Description:
GRAEF, a leading U.S. consulting firm, has been providing exceptional careers and quality engineering, planning and design services to our clients since 1961. We recognize that the best workplaces are filled with technically excellent, innovative, creative, and highly motivated people. GRAEF is more than just a business. We are a committed employer and community member. We invest in our employees as we do our clients, providing a challenging and rewarding environment where you can grow both personally and professionally. GRAEF values exciting work and lasting relationships; we embody values that speak to loyalty, service, quality and integrity; and we strive to grow with these ideas leading the way. We re looking for people who agree that in addition to technical excellence, it s all about relationships! What are you looking for in a career? The opportunity to work on exciting, high-profile projects? The satisfaction and security of working at an employee-owned company? Or maybe the opportunity to improve the quality of life - not just for you and your family, but for the worldwide community at large?
Our dynamic growth and continued success has created a new opportunity for an Entry Level Structural Engineer in our Orlando, FL office. As a Structural Engineer at GRAEF, you will work in a collaborative team environment on a wide variety of facility projects including education, aviation, transportation, hospitality, commercial, industrial and renovation projects. This full-time position has significant growth opportunities for the right candidate!
As an Entry Level Structural Engineer at GRAEF, enjoy responsibilities that include:
Design and detailing of a variety of buildings and structures.
Analysis and renovations of existing buildings and structures.
Coordinate with project team members across multiple disciplines, attend project meetings, and construction administration including site visits.
Use of Revit for construction documentation and coordination with project team members.
Assist senior staff with coordinating, directing, and checking the work of technicians or other engineers and with managing project scope and schedule.
We are considering Entry Level Structural Engineer candidates to join our team who possess the following basic qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering with a focus in Structural Engineering.
Master's degree in structural engineering a plus.
Professional experience through relatable internships in structural design of buildings is preferred.
EIT certification a plus.
Experience with Revit a significant plus as is having experience in various structural engineering software.
The ability to work independently is crucial.

Title: Estimating Engineer
Job Description:
Zing Recruiting has partnered with an Industrial Shelving Company in the Paris, Kentucky area and is seeking an experienced Estimating Engineer to join their team. This position is responsible for analyzing customer requirements, preparing an estimate of costs, and providing the customer with a quote in an accurate and timely manner. If you have a strong estimating background, I encourage you to apply!
Job Summary
Role: Estimating Engineer
Full Time/Direct Hire
Salary: $65K-80K/yr.
M-F 8am-4:30pm (Hybrid option available when training commences)
Analyze drawings, designs, specifications, and documentation to prepare bill of materials and cost estimates
Interpret all levels of requests for Quotation requirements from conceptual through design and manufacturing phases
Apply labor, material overhead, period costs, and profit requirements to each estimate
Maintain an effective line of communication with customers and internal departments to ensure customers are provided with excellent service
Provide improvement recommendations to reduce future discrepancies between estimated and actual costs.

Visit job sites for critical quotes and projects to identify requirements and potential problems
Review manufacturing and installer related feedback from customers to improve future quoting
Effectively communicate with Purchasing on buy-out items & freight charges
Update cost templates to reflect tariffs, current steel prices, and other details
Conduct turn over meetings with Project management
Improve knowledge base of codes from different cities and states.
Participate in the training and development of other Estimators
Maintain One Note file to capture history of changes and customer communications
Recommends and supports the implementation of improvements initiatives
Perform other job duties as needed.

Degree in engineering technology or related field preferred
Ability to operate AutoCAD 2D
Proficient in SolidWorks
Working knowledge of engineering and design concepts of steel structures
Effective interpersonal, communication and teamwork skills
Able to interpret and translate sketches, layouts, prints, and written requirements with a high degree of accuracy
Ability to work seamlessly with customers, vendors, and other internal departments
Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business communications, policies, procedures, and governmental regulations
Ability to write reports and business correspondences and effectively present information to management and customers.
Proficient in MS office suite with a strong understanding of Excel
SolidWorks or other 3D design is a plus
Experience with SAP2000 or equivalent structural analysis software
Must have manual dexterity in both hands.

Title: Structural Engineer (Entry Level)
Job Description:
Structural Engineer :(Entry Level)
Location: Fargo, ND

Have you always been enthralled by bridges or other structures around you? We are currently seeking a Structural Engineer to join our team in Fargo, ND. This role is perfect whether you graduated a few years ago or you are graduating soon. Come and be part of the growing team and thriving culture.

Essential Functions:
Assist in the design and plan preparation for structures including bridges, lift stations, retaining walls, as well as non-typical structures including floodwalls, underground reservoirs, large pipes, culverts, and other civil structures.
Coordinate with other engineering departments on complex multi-discipline projects.
Analyze reports, maps, and other data to plan and design projects.
Provide periodic onsite construction inspections and safety inspections of existing structures.
Utilize structural engineering software to perform complex and simple structural engineering solutions.
Collaborate with CAD designers and subcontractors regarding design plans.
Assist with in service bridge inspections.

Likely project areas include steel and concrete bridges, box culverts, flood walls, inlet and outlet structures, retaining walls, water reservoirs and lift stations.

Education, Experience and Skills :
Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering with structural emphasis.
Knowledge of or ability to learn concrete, steel, and masonry design codes, as well as local and national building codes required.
Ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks.
Proficiency or ability to learn Microsoft Office and AutoCAD.
Strong technical, written, and verbal communication skills.
Excellent problem solving and analytical skills.

Benefits of Joining HEI:
As part of our talented staff, you will enjoy competitive pay, significant annual bonuses, paid health, dental, vision, life insurance, short and long-term disability, PTO, paid holidays, parental leave, generous 401(k) match, access to HSA & FSAs, flexible schedules, annual HEI logo wear, plus more.

Additionally, view our careers page to read about HEI being selected as one of the ENR top 500 design firms and as one of the PB 50 best places to work for several years in a row!

Title: Structural Engineer II
Job Description:
Company Description

At AECOM, we’re delivering a better world.
We believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether it’s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive.
Our clients trust us to bring together the best people, ideas, technical expertise and digital solutions to our work in transportation, buildings, water, the environment and new energy. We’re one global team – 47,000 strong – driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world.
Here, you will have freedom to grow in a world of opportunity.
We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.
You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.
We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business.
We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career.
When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.

Job Description

AECOM Buildings + Places is actively seeking a talented Structural Engineer for employment in the Boston, MA office.

This position is expected to begin immediately.
Responsibilities for this position include but are not limited to
Performs structural design of buildings and transportation structures and prepares related engineering calculations and structural modeling. Building types may include but are not limited to commercial buildings, government buildings, transit rail stations and airport terminals.
Prepares Structural BIM models.
Develops Structural Construction Documents/Drawings including framing plans, structural sections, structural details, structural schedules, etc.
Provides specialized technical input to studies and design for staff's specific area of expertise
Prepares technical specification sections.
Performs visual survey of existing building structures.
Performs structural observations site visits during the construction phase of projects.
Performs work in accordance with agreed upon budget and schedule with supervision from Sr. Engineers.
Proposes approach to solve new problems encountered
Coordinates with other in-house engineering disciplines as needed.
Travel to project site and meetings as needed

Qualifications

Minimum Requirements:
BS in Structural Engineering or Civil Engineering with two (2) + years of related experience in structural design or demonstrated equivalency of experience and/or education.
Preferred Qualifications:
Masters degree in Civil/Structural Engineering
EIT License
Experience in one or more of the following software: ETABS, SAP, SAFE, RAM Structural, TEDDS, SAP2000
Experience in BIM, Revit

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
With infrastructure investment accelerating worldwide, our services are in great demand, and there’s never been a better time to be at AECOM! Join us, and you’ll get all the benefits of being a part of a global, publicly traded firm – access to industry-leading technology and thinking and transformational work with big impact and work flexibility.
AECOM provides a wide array of compensation and benefits programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. We also provide a robust global well-being program. We’re the world’s trusted global infrastructure firm, and we’re in this together – your growth and success are ours too.
As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.
Join us and let’s get started.

Title: Assistant Structural Engineer - Water Supply (Denver)
Job Description:
Description
Burns & McDonnell’s Water Practice in Denver, CO is in search of an Assistant Structural Engineer for its growing Water Practice. Founded in 1898, Burns & McDonnell is a 100% employee-owned firm. The Assistant Structural Engineer will work on project teams to create world class designs for new projects, alterations and redevelopments on a variety of municipal and industrial water/wastewater projects. Typical structures include concrete vaults and wet-wells, tanks (filters, aeration basins, clarifiers, etc.), and pump stations. Typical building types to support our projects are masonry, pre-cast concrete, and pre-engineered metal buildings. In addition to design of new structures, condition assessments of existing facilities and recommendations for rehabilitation is expected. The Assistant Structural Engineer will work with the project team throughout the design and construction process, adapting structural plans according to budget constraints, design factors, or client needs.
Perform structural design of projects from the conceptual phase through design completion.
Modify and review production drawings to meet project requirements.
Design structural components for project needs and requirements that are set forth by the project managers.
Applies strong knowledge of commonly used structural engineering/design concepts, principles, practices, codes, and procedures within the structural engineering services industry.
Research and compile project related data as required by the project managers.
Update drawings provided by senior engineers to verify corrections are made within multiple CAD related software.
Perform field inspections, measurements or calculations for public and private clients.
All other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
Bachelor of Science in Structural Engineering or related degree from an ABET accredited program.
Or Bachelor of Science in Structural or related Engineering Technology from an ABET accredited program and successful completion of Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) exam.
Master of Science degree in Engineering may be substituted for one year of experience.
Successful completion of Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) or Engineer-in-Training (EIT) strongly preferred.
Minimum of a 3.0 GPA strongly preferred.
Master of Science in Structural Engineering or related degree preferred.
Prior internship and/or related consulting experience preferred.
Involvement on campus or in the community.
Basic knowledge in standard structural engineering techniques, principles and procedures.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to work methodically and analytically in a quantitative problem-solving environment and demonstrated critical thinking skills.
Proficient computer skills (e.g. Microsoft Office Suite).
Basic computer skills include structural analysis programs (e.g., RISA), AutoCAD and BIM (e.g., Revit and Tekla).
Strong attention to detail, facilitation, team building, collaboration, organization and problem solving skills.
Demonstrated leadership skills.
Candidates must be legally authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis without requiring future sponsorship for employment visa status.
Compensation Range
$75000-$110000
The expected compensation range for this position is displayed in compliance with all local/state regulations. The expected compensation range for this position is based on a number of factors, including but not limited to: individual education, qualifications, prior work experience and work location. The total annual compensation package will consist of a base salary and eligibility to participate in our discretionary year-end incentive bonus program.
Benefits
Our extensive benefits package takes care of you so that you can focus on doing great work. From insurance and disability to time off and wellness programs, we provide the tools to meet your needs. As part of being 100% employeeowned, eligible employees participate in our Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP) in addition to our 401(k) retirement program. For more information, please visit the Benefits & Wellness page.

Title: Civil/Structural AutoCAD Designer
Job Description:
GSE Workforce Solutions is currently working with a major client who are seeking to hire a Civil/Structural AutoCAD Designer on a long-term contract basis located in St. Louis, MO
63166, starting ASAP!

This work is with a utility and is supporting the construction and rehab of transmission substations, service buildings and other company transmission properties.

1 year+ Contract assignment. Compensation of $32-38/hr., based on experience, plus time and a half for overtime.

Requirements:
Satisfactory completion of an Associate’s Degree in in design drafting, computer aided drafting or other drafting technology at an accredited university, college or junior college.
Satisfactory completion of at least 15 credit hours in the field of structural/civil design, civil/ structural engineering, or other study of civil/structural technology at an accredited university, college or junior college.
Five years as a Civil/Structural Designer
Expertise using AutoCAD.

Responsibilities:
Under indirect and intermittent supervision, to perform responsible work requiring ability to take independent action and make decisions, in preparing basic sketches, making calculations, and formulating the designs for construction and rehabilitation projects for transmission substations, service buildings, and other Company transmission properties; and to do related work as required.
In this connection to perform details of work, such as: Create or modify layout drawings, site plans, grading, foundations, steel, equipment, grounding, and other civil/structural drawings on which no definite design has been established other than the basic engineering, and for which information may be supplied in the form of sketches, specifications, or verbal instructions.

Title: Junior Structural Engineer
Job Description:
Junior Structural Engineer
The Junior Structural Engineer position is responsible and accountable for assisting in the development of design and technical systems for projects from schematics through construction administration.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Follow design process and procedures so the department is organized and runs efficiently.
Under the direction of the Structural Engineer review analysis and design with structural assessments and evaluation of existing structures.
Calculate the load and grade requirements or material stress factors to determine design specifications.
Create graphical representations of structures and recommend technical design or process changes to improve efficiency, quality or performance.
Perform calculations for building gravity and lateral structural systems in accordance with local building codes.
Review tests such as soil, material, strength of foundations, concrete or steel.
Communicate with clients when necessary.
All other duties as assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS
Understanding of A/E/C industry terminology and procedures.
Knowledge of design techniques, tools, and principles involved in production of precision technical plans, blueprints, drawings and models.
Understanding of building codes, government regulations, OSHA regulations and safety procedures.
Knowledge of AutoCAD software and other structural design software.
Extremely organized and detailed oriented, with the ability to maintain accuracy while handling multiple requests in a growing company environment.
Highly analytical with the ability to calculate complex mathematical equations.
Knowledge of Microsoft Office.

EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE
Bachelor’s degree (B. S., or B.A.) in Civil Engineering and a minimum of three (3) years related experience in A/E/C industry.

CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS
Engineer In Training (EIT),

TRAVEL
This position requires minimal travel (less than 10%).

PHYSICAL DEMANDS
The incumbent in this position can typically expect to sit and use his/her hands to handle and feel for more than 2/3 of the day. He/she can expect to stand or walk for more than 1/3 of the day. Talking and listening is also expected for more than 2/3 of the day. The ability to climb or balance; stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl; or reach with arms will be needed for less than 1/3 of the day.
This position requires that the incumbent be able to lift items up to 10 pounds on an infrequent basis.
The incumbent in this position should have clear vision at 20 inches or less. He/she should be able to view various reports and forms as well as information displayed on a computer monitor and have the ability to distinguish between different colors. Depth perception, peripheral vision, the ability to focus and the ability to see for a distance are also necessary.

EEO STATEMENT
Gedeon GRC Consulting is an equal opportunity employer. We will not discriminate against employees or applicants for employment because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability or military status or any other protected class. This policy shall apply to all employment actions, including but not limited to recruitment, hiring, upgrading, promotions, transfer, demotion, layoff, recall, termination, rates of pay, or other forms of compensation and selection for training, including apprenticeship, at all levels of employment.

Title: Mid-Level Structural Analysis Engineer
Job Description:
At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.
Boeing Corporate is currently looking for a Mid-Level Structural Analysis Engineer to join the team in Tukwila, WA.
Position Responsibilities:
Leads development, integration and documentation of structural requirements to establish the system design
Coordinates with other engineering groups to establish the product's environment
Guides product design and verifies structural integrity by using and developing analytical methods, finite element models/simulations and other analysis tools throughout the product lifecycle to develop the structural environment, characteristics and performance
Leads development of test plans and configurations, supports test execution and analyzes/reports test results to validate and verify systems and components meet requirements and specifications. Defines and documents certification and test results to substantiate for customers and regulatory agencies that requirements are satisfied
Supports in-service products by leading investigations into failures and analyzing improvements. Develops analytical processes/tools to improve effectiveness, quality and efficiency of the development effort
Self-starter with a positive attitude, high ethics, and a track record of working successfully under pressure in a time-constrained environment
Good verbal and written communication skills to liaise with several Stakeholders
Works under minimal direction
This position is expected to be 100% onsite. The selected candidate will be required to work onsite at one of the listed location options.
The position must meet Export Control compliance requirements, therefore a “US Person” as defined by 22 C.F.R. § 120.15 is required. “US Person” includes US Citizen, lawful permanent resident, refugee, or asylee.
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor degree from an accredited course of study in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics or chemistry
5+ years’ experience with aerospace stress analysis and/or structural analysis using classical structural analysis methodology
Experience with engineering fundamentals such as material properties, free-body diagrams, structural loads and analysis methods
Preferred Qualifications:
Master's Degree or higher from an accredited course of study in engineering, computer science, mathematics or physics
Experience with structural design principles for aircraft primary structures (e.g., fatigue, damage tolerance, corrosion, stress analysis, statics, materials strength, material characteristics, and repair techniques)
Combination of metallic and composite experience
Experience performing hand calculations , CAD system ( e.g. CATIA/ENOVIA) , FEM software (e.g., ABAQUS, PATRAN/NASTRAN, Hyper works)
Experience with Aircraft Primary Structures on Boeing Commercial Derivatives – Commercial and/or Military applications (737, 747, 757, 767 & 777)
Active U.S. Secret Clearance
Typical Education/Experience:
Education/experience typically acquired through advanced technical education from an accredited course of study in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics or chemistry (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 5 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of technical education and experience (e.g. PhD, Master+3 years' related work experience). In the USA, ABET accreditation is the preferred, although not required, accreditation standard.
Relocation:
This position offers relocation based on candidate eligibility.
Drug Free Workplace:
Boeing is a Drug Free Workplace where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies.
Shift:
This position is for 1st shift.
Union:
This is a union-represented position.
