Title: Construction Manager
Job Description:
The Construction Manager is responsible for leading all aspects of our critical home repair and new home construction and managing volunteers on work sites. In addition, responsibilities include facility and equipment management, various construction-related activities, and always being a positive representative and advocate for Habitat in our service area. The starting salary is between $42,000 - $55,000, based on experience, and includes health insurance, life insurance, and retirement. Relocation costs may be covered.

Our office is in Bay Saint Louis, MS, one of the coolest beach communities on the Gulf Coast. The people are friendly. The vibe is casual. The water is warm. We are just a short drive away from New Orleans and Gulfport. Foder’s Travel selected us as one of America’s 25 Favorite Beach Towns and USA Today’s Top 10 Best Coastal Small Towns. We are a great place to live, work, play, and serve.

Key Responsibilities:
Work with other staff to review potential projects and assist in project selection.
Create work scopes, material lists, and budgets.
Instruct, lead, and manage volunteers and partner families onsite in various workday construction and repair tasks.
Oversee job site safety to ensure we adhere to best safe construction practices.
Manage Habitat facilities, equipment maintenance, and other minor construction-related issues that come up from time to time.
Stay on top of best practices for outstanding Habitat affiliates in construction, home repair, volunteer management, and other innovations within Habitat.
Ensure that our volunteers have a great experience.
Be an outstanding representative of our mission and organization at all times and in every way.
Work with Habitat staff to ensure an orderly and efficient process for completing projects.
Ensure quality construction and Habitat’s commitment to building energy-efficient, healthy homes and staying current on green and fortified building trends.
Attend regular staff meetings and serve as a vital and contributing member of the affiliate leadership team.
Build relationships with churches, businesses, vendors, community partners, skilled trades, and others to ensure our affiliate is best positioned to advance our mission.

Key Requirements:
This individual should have experience in construction or equivalent education in Construction Management or a related field.
This individual should be an excellent communicator (written and verbal) and capable of working well with people.
A licensed contractor or the ability to obtain a license promptly is required.
Prior Habitat experience is strongly preferred. We will consider Americorp, NCCC, or other nonprofit construction experiences favorably.


To apply for this position, send cover letter and resume to OperationsDirector@habitatbw.org No phone calls, please.

Title: Construction Manager
Job Description:
Voltera’s mission is to move the world closer to a zero-emissions future through tackling the toughest challenges associated with EV charging infrastructure. We site, build, and operate EV charging depots for commercial fleets across sectors ranging from delivery and distribution to autonomous vehicles and ride hailing. We're looking for innovative, people-first team members who understand that culture is critical to our ability to positively impact the world's transition toward clean energy and transportation.
We are looking for an experienced, mission aligned Construction Manager that will manage major construction projects that drive the deployment of our EV charging infrastructure and position Voltera as a premier partner. This role will own multiple construction projects with a focus of achieving the highest level of safety, quality, and productivity on each project. The ideal candidate will be a versatile construction management expert and will have a strong emphasis on bringing people together to meet timelines within budget.
WHAT YOU’LL DO:
Partner with customers and external contractors for the overall project delivery, including the management of the project deployment in accordance with both the customer and Voltera’s objectives
Drive construction efforts including coordination of activities, suppliers, craft labor, subcontractors, and startup / testing activities
Manage and provide construction oversight and facilitate resolution to complex construction project related issues, disputes, and disagreements
Create, review, and analyze monthly reports on project construction budget, schedule, and quality performance to identify the best course of action throughout the project plan
Cross-functionally partner to achieve the overall objectives
Effectively manage multiple projects, proactively communicate, and tackle project challenges
Perform additional responsibilities as assigned
MUST-HAVE:
Undergraduate or graduate degree in Construction Management, Engineering, Architecture; or related
7+ years of related construction project management experience
Related EV charging experience
Strong working knowledge of building systems/components and technology, contract management, and project delivery methods
Experience managing ground-up new construction
Self-starter and ability to work in a fast-paced environment with little direction
Strong and effective team player in working cross functionally and willingness to work outside of core job function
Ability to manage a high volume of projects with tight turnaround timelines and prioritize accordingly with strong attention to detail
NICE-TO-HAVE:
Certified Construction Manager (CCM), CM-Lean, DBIA Professional, Professional Engineer (PE) or Architect license/certification
LOCATION:
Remote, USA
Compensation ($115,000 to $138,000): Exact compensation may vary based on skills, experience, and location. Our total compensation package includes the base salary and competitive benefits.
Voltera believes diversity – of thought, backgrounds, and experiences – affects all that we do, from our employees to the solutions we deliver. Our goal is to create an environment in which inclusion through diversity helps deepen the lives and work experience of our employees, enhances our innovation and creativity, and enriches our involvement in our communities. Voltera is an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, as well as any other category protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws.

Job Description:
The Quality Division Manager is responsible for development, implementation, and enforcement of the company s quality control operations. Ideal candidates will have significant experience working as a Quality Manager for large construction projects. Experienced Project Managers with an interest in a role that is dedicated to Quality enforcement are encouraged to apply.

Overall management of the Quality Division
Developing and managing all provisions of the Quality Manual (corporate and site-specific)
Planning and managing requirements established by the Quality Manual and Owner Quality requirements

Manage corrective action plans as necessary
Resolving quality non-conformance issues in conjunction with the Regional Quality Managers

Title: New Home Construction Assistant Superintendent
Job Description:
At Adams Homes, we like to create win-win situations for our employees, craftsmen, and our clients. Since 1991, our success is based upon keeping things simple along with the design, quality, and affordability of our homes. We recognize that people are truly what makes the difference and that you are only as good as the people with whom you surround yourself.
Each member of the Adams Homes family is hired based on the following qualities: A positive "Can Do!" attitude, a strong work ethic, and is a coachable team player.
We’re seeking a New Home Assistant Superintendent to join our construction management team, and train/work in Brunswick, New Hanover, Pender and Onslow Counties.
HERE'S WHY YOU SHOULD APPLY: Construction experience preferred but not required. As long as you’re ambitious and coachable, we'll show you the ropes through our hands-on training program.
If you are ready to kick start your career with one of the largest homebuilders in the Southeast, we’re ready for you!
The Ideal Candidate Should Demonstrate The Following Traits:
Dependable
Great Communicator
Ability to multi-task
Efficient
Self-Motivated
Our Superintendent Assistants oversee the construction of new homes and ensure high-quality service to our clients by performing the following duties:
Providing professional communication with trade partners, suppliers, building officials, homeowners, and other Adams Homes team members
Exhibiting high attention to detail and organizational skills
Following the construction scheduling process proficiently
Demonstrating a friendly attitude and persistent work ethic
Daily visit job sites to inspect quality, monitor schedules, and provide any necessary guidance to ensure homes are completed on time and in accordance with our quality standards
You will be proud to say you work as a Assistant Superintendent at Adams Homes. Accredited by the BBB, Adams Homes is a leading new home builder with over 30 years of success. We have built more than 50,000 homes across the Southeast since 1991 with over 400 team members, and 30 individual offices, all with one goal - “VALUE, Simplified”.
We not only just applaud ourselves for our hard work, but we also take pride in providing a fun-filled environment for our Team Members. We also reward our team members that are driven by performance through a highly competitive compensation program.
Join the Adams Homes Family by applying today!
Adams Homes is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, age, national origin, sexual orientation, or religious perspective.”

Title: Civil Engineering Manager
Job Description:
Civil Engineer
Job description
CROW ENGINEERING, INC. is a multi-disciplined consulting engineering firm serving the mechanical, structural, and civil engineering needs of a diverse range of clients. We have a rich history of serving the wood products, food processing, and cold-storage warehousing industries. We are the lead consultants for most of our clients. This presents our employees with the opportunity to directly engage with the end user.
Due to our growth in the civil engineering space, this is a new position for Crow. If you are interested in being a part of a growing team in an established business, this position may be a good fit for you.
Job Description:
This position will be responsible for:
· Mentoring and Managing Civil EITs and Designers
· Working with Crow principals to plan resources and project commitments
· Collaborating with project managers to define project deliverables and outcomes
· Executing engineering, design and drafting (as required) to meet the project deliverables.
Projects for this position will include the development and modernization of heavy industrial facilities across the US. Most of the work will be with wood products manufactures (sawmills), cold storage facilities, or other manufacturing and distribution clients. Design work for this position will generally focus on developing stormwater systems, roadways for rolling stock, civil feature design in support of manufacturing equipment, and general grading for site operations.
Responsibilities:
Responsible for managing and mentoring staff. Managing their daily activities. And growing our team to meet the overall needs of the company.
Prioritizes workload for team members, creates resource forecasts and manages changes in team priorities.
Member of Crow's management team that proactively builds processes, training opportunties and other activities to develop their teams.
Prepares construction documents for civil (site development) engineering activities.
Must be able to work in both a 2D environment as well as utilize 3D or BIM tools to create 2-D drawing products. Must be fluent in AutoCAD, specifically Civil3D. Familiarity or experience with REVIT also a plus.
Must be able to accurately draw from sketches or specifications using appropriate symbology, terms, procedures and drafting standards.
Draw civil plans (site plans, grading and stormwater plans, utility plans), diagrams, and profiles, using cross-sections and surveys.
Coaches EIT’s and other designers to successfully meet project requirements.
Able to produce drawing sets that are easy for contractors to do determine the client requirements.
Experience preparing hydrology calculations required.
Basic structural design knowledge preferred as well as a willingness to supplement civil engineering design with structural engineering tasks a bonus for candidate
Determine the order of work and method of presentation, such as orthographic or isometric drawing.
Review rough sketches, drawings, specifications, and other engineering data received from civil and structural engineers to ensure that they conform to design concepts.
Effective communication with the design team to plan, develop drawings, basic design models, and resolve problems.
Must be able to work with local jurisdictions to determine the requirements to the permitting process, and submit future deliverables to match those requirements.
Position will have the opportunity to travel to job sites, on occasion.
Position Requirements:
Must have a working knowledge of the Windows Operating System including email, word processing, spreadsheet, database, and computer-aided drafting applications (AutoCAD and other Autodesk Programs).
Bachelor’s degree in drafting/design/engineering technology or equivalent 5-7 years of industry-related civil experience or structural experience.
Personnel Management Experience
Professional Civil Engineer
Candidate must be able to show that they can rely on their experience, as an engineer, to design solutions that may not be adequately defined in the jurisdictional requirements.
Candidate must be comfortable doing hand calculations and generally not being overly reliant of software systems to determine engineering outcomes.
Must be able to provide leadership and direction with the following outside third parties:
Local Permitting Jurisdictions
Survey Teams
Geotechnical Engineers
Additional Skills Required for the role include:
Must be a self-starter and be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment
Must be comfortable making decisions
Basic construction experience or knowledge
Problem Solving
Critical Thinking
Attention to Detail
Strong desire to learn and help others

Title: Geologist / Environmental Staff Engineer
Job Description:
Rare opportunity to join an experienced engineering team to assist with geotechnical and environmental projects by conducting fieldwork and field investigations! Projects may include work for the government as well as contractors and real estate clients.

The client is open to considering candidates with different experience levels, making this an excellent opportunity to grow your career with a successful firm. Apply today for immediate consideration!

Full-time, Monday to Friday, 8:00am-5:00pm. May require occasional overtime, including evenings, nights, Saturdays, Sundays, and holidays.
Location
Honolulu, Oahu
Pay
$18 to $25 an hour

Take environmental samplings (e.g., soil, groundwater, etc.) for environmental investigations.
Prepare Environmental Site Assessments (ESA).
Perform geotechnical lab testing.
Collect, compile and analyze technical data.
Generate reports, diagrams, charts, drawings, specifications, and procedures.
Provide proposals and cost estimates.
Coordinate project tasks with sub consultants, clients and contractors as needed.
Prepare project and workforce scheduling as needed.
Perform other duties as assigned.

Internship or professional work experience with geotechnical engineering, geological, or geoscience companies preferred.

Title: ENTRY-LEVEL ENGINEERING LAB TECHNICIAN
Job Description:
Job: SK Geotechnical is a leading geotechnical engineering and materials testing company in Montana and is currently seeking a self-motivated individual with a positive attitude to join our team as an engineering technician. As described below, the successful candidate must be capable of performing a wide variety of field and laboratory materials testing, inspection, and reporting. For those applicants with little experience, SK Geotechnical has a detail-oriented training program matching the needs of the new technician.
Description: Effectively perform all engineering technician duties and responsibilities as described below. Perform field work on construction sites and laboratory tests in office, and prepare reports for clients. Must have a positive attitude, be honest with all aspects of work and communication, and be willing to occasionally travel.
Specific duties include:
Uses safe work practices.
Performs all materials testing on construction projects, including compaction tests, concrete tests, rebar inspection, fireproofing inspection, and all other types of field services. Construction experience is highly desirable.
Performs all types of laboratory testing, including Proctors, gradations, Atterberg limits, specific gravity, consolidation, and all other lab tests.
Input test results into software (primarily Excel), review to 100 percent accuracy.
Reads/understands job specifications and performs tests to those specifications.
Calls client with test results and scheduling as requested.
Informs supervisor or engineering staff if on-site conditions or practices appear questionable.
Maintains test equipment in accordance with SK Geotechnical's accreditation, manufacturer's and/or test specifications.
Reviews daily reports for accuracy and final reporting.
Maintains accurate records of chargeable and non-chargeable time.
Maintains a clean lab and company vehicles.
Assists geotechnical engineers on field and laboratory work, such as staking borings, surveying, percolation tests, loading equipment, etc.
Out-of-town work will be required (up to 20 percent), including day trips as well as occasional larger materials testing projects.
Requirements:
Typically, two to five years of experience as an engineering technician with industry certifications, preferably with a minimum two-year associates degree in engineering, science or related discipline. Experience with construction projects such as earthwork, trenching, and concrete highly beneficial. Having no experience is also acceptable, we will train.
Mathematical skills.
Computer and calculator skills.
Must be able to lift 75 pounds and operate a wheelbarrow..
Benefits:
Health insurance through Associated Employers of Montana (AEM).
Health savings account (HSA) contribution of $1,800 per year.
401K Plan with Match
Profit Sharing
Seven paid holidays
Up to 4 weeks of accumulated sick leave, 6 days per year
Up to three weeks' vacation
Life Insurance
Dental/Vision Reimbursement
Benefits are worth approximately $20,000 to $25,000 per year, on top of salary.
Salary:
$22 to $26 per hour depending on experience and capabilities.
Many opportunities for overtime pay (1.5 times per hour) beyond 40 hour week.
Information: SK Geotechnical is a full service, locally owned geotechnical engineering company in Billings, Montana. Our goal is to provide the very best geotechnical engineering, construction materials testing, construction inspection, and drilling services in the region. Overtime is common during the busy season. When out of town, company pays for individual motel room and meal allowance.
Please complete our application at SKGeotechnical.com, including current Motor Vehicle Record (MVR). SK Geotechnical is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Affirmative Action Employer. Position is open until filled.

Pay: $22.00 - $26.00 per hour
Benefits:
401(k)
401(k) matching

Title: Entry Level Structural Engineering Graduate
Job Description:
Our People & Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the "why" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.

Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.


Your Impact:

Our People & Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the "why" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.
Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.
Do you enjoy the study and review of the natural environment before a construction project takes place? At Jacobs-we do as well.
Based in (NYC), you’ll have the chance to perform geotechnical engineering design and analysis of foundation systems, retaining structures and slopes for transportation infrastructure projects for both public and private clients. Your engineering skills will be developed with design and analysis of shallow and deep foundations including piles and drilled shafts, retaining walls and support of excavation systems.
You’ll also inspect geotechnical exploratory and construction related activities and specifically, develop as well as oversight of subsurface investigation and laboratory testing programs.
You’ll work with the best Engineers and Project Managers in the business. We want you to be empowered to deliver the boldest solutions for everyday living. If you want to join a company invested in you and your success- join us as an Entry Level Geotechnical Engineer.
At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.
Typical salary range for this position is $64,000 to $80,000 and is commensurate with experience relative to the position.
Here’s What You’ll Need:
Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering with a focus in Geotechnical Engineering
Flexibility to travel for office and field assignments
Strong analytical, conceptual, and organizational skills
Familiarity with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Ideally, you’ll also have:
At least a 3.0 GPA
MS degree in Geotechnical Engineering
Engineer in Training (EIT) or ability to obtain within 6 months.
Previous internship in geotechnical evaluations soil and rock classification, design analysis of foundation and ground retention systems
Knowledge of and experience with Ensoft APile, LPile, and Group, Slide or GeoStudio Slope, GRLWeap, DeepEXcav, Civiltech Shoring Suite, Bentley gINT, Bentley MicroStation, and AutoCAD
Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Learn more about your rights under Federal EEO laws and supplemental language.

At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private sector.

Title: Geotechnical Engineer/Associate
Job Description:
Exponent is a leading engineering and scientific consulting firm that brings together more than 90 different disciplines to solve the most pressing and complicated challenges facing stakeholders today. Our vision is to engage the brightest scientists and engineers to empower clients with solutions for a safe, healthy, sustainable and technologically complex world. We leverage over 50 years of experience in analyzing accidents and failures to advise clients as they innovate their technologically complex products and processes, ensure the safety and health of their users, and address the challenges of sustainability.
We offer opportunities for you to expand your engineering or scientific knowledge amidst experts with degrees from top programs at over 500 universities. At Exponent, you will apply your experience, technical skills, and prior academic research to a fulfilling career in consulting. You will have the opportunity to develop continuously through formal and informal development programs, coaching and mentoring, and involvement in a wide array of projects. We are excited about your interest in joining our growing team!
Key statistics:
1100+ Team members
900+ Consultants
550+ Ph.D.s
30+ Offices globally
We are currently seeking a Geotechnical Engineer/Associate for our Civil Engineering Practice in Los Angeles, California. In this role you will work as part of a team responsible for the inspection, analysis, and evaluation geotechnical systems (e.g., foundations, retaining walls, excavation support systems, levees, dams, slopes, etc.) and frequently the preparation of repair/mitigation concepts.
You will be responsible for:
Conducting field inspections and subsurface explorations
Performing geotechnical and civil engineering analyses
Assisting with peer review of the design and construction of geotechnical systems
Preparing conceptual designs for the repair/restoration of damaged geotechnical systems
You will have the following skills and qualifications:
Ph.D. in Civil Engineering specializing in Geotechnical Engineering from an accredited university or M.S. plus 5 years' experience
Degrees, experience or related coursework in Geology/Geological Engineering, Groundwater/Surface Water Hydrology or Structural Engineering a strong plus
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills and potential to develop successful client relations
Attention to detail, dedication to quality and accuracy, desire to work in a fast paced environment, and effective leadership skills
Ability to work independently or support multiple group projects and to interact with other engineers, administrative staff, and clients
Ability to gather information from a wide variety of sources (e.g., field investigations, document reviews, and interviews) and to synthesize and convey technical conclusions to individuals in engineering, business, and industry
Knowledge of geotechnical modeling software, graphing software and imaging software a strong plus
Applicants are encouraged to submit a CV (Curriculum Vitae) with publications (feel free to include publications that are in review or pending) [not restricted to 1 page].
To learn more about life at Exponent and our impact, please visit the following links:
https://info.exponent.com/our-impact
www.exponent.com/careers/grad-students
We value and encourage diversity, equity and inclusion across all facets of our firm. Having a team built of people with different backgrounds, skills and perspectives allows us to provide better value to our clients and enjoy an enriched work environment.
Our firm is committed to offering a variety of programs and resources to support health and well-being. We believe that providing competitive benefits as well as compensation and recognition programs empowers our staff to do work that makes a difference.
Compensation
Our consultants are rewarded for their technical and business contributions and have an opportunity to plan for future success and career growth. Exponent's total compensation plan is consistent with its expectations of the quality and quantity of work performed and with the professional standards set by Exponent. At the Associate and Senior Associate level total compensation includes base salary, bi-weekly bonuses for high intensity efforts, annual bonus and 401(k) employer contribution of 7% of base salary.
The base salary range for this position is $96,000 - $115,000 depending on experience and capabilities which will be assessed during the interview process.
Benefits
Access benefits information at this link.
Exponent is a proud equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected status.
If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability, you may email us at HR-Accommodations@exponent.com.

Title: Junior Level Geotechnical Engineer
Job Description:
Our People & Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the "why" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.

Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.


Your Impact:

As a Geotechnical Engineer, you’ll work with our growing geotechnical practice consisting of close to 150 geotechnical engineers in over 15 offices in North America supporting a wide variety of civil infrastructure projects. We’ll give you the opportunity to follow projects from the conceptual phase through to the construction phase, working on traditional design-bid-build as well as design-build projects.
In your role you’ll work in a collaborative multi-disciplinary team while you share your technical knowledge across geographical boundaries to foster innovative project solutions while you work in locations both within the USA and around the world supporting projects small and large while you work with and under the supervision of some of the highest-quality geotechnical engineers in the United States.
You’ll participate in field assignments that will include observation of explorations (soil and rock borings, test pits, CPT soundings, geophysical testing); installation of geotechnical instrumentation and monitoring; and inspection and construction of geotechnical structures (earth retaining structures, deep foundations, dams, tunnels, and shallow foundations). You’ll analyze field logs, laboratory and field testing results, and use your knowledge and judgement to work with senior geotechnical engineers in selecting geotechnical design parameters. During your time with us you’ll also design shallow and deep foundations, earth retaining structures, ground improvement, embankments, cut slopes, and other geotechnical structures and perform seismic hazard analyses, including site-response studies, liquefaction evaluations, seismic slope stability evaluations, etc. You’ll prepare clear and well-organized calculation packages, as well as document the results of the calculations in well-written, clear, and concise technical memorandums, technical reports, data reports and baseline reports and use computer programs including Settle3D, Slide, APile, Unipile, LPILE, Shaft, FB-MultiPier, DeepXcav, GRLWeap, FLAC, PLAXIS, gINT, SNAP2 and MathCAD to complete engineering analysis. Preparing design drawings and construction specifications, and review construction submittals for compliance with contract requirements and design assumptions will also be part of your normal job function.
Jacobs health and welfare benefits are designed to invest in you, and in the things you care about. Your health. Your well-being. Your security. Your future. Typical benefits offered include flexible work schedules and opportunities to work remotely, educational reimbursement, retirement benefits, employee stock purchase plan, health benefits, disability benefits, life and accident insurance, voluntary benefits, paid time off and paid holidays, and parental leave.
Typical salary range for this position is $72,000 - $95,000 and is commensurate with experience relative to the position. For “remote” positions, salary to be offered is geographic dependent.

Here’s What You’ll Need:

0-5 years of experience
• BS in Civil Engineering
• MS in Civil Engineering with an emphasis on Geotechnical Engineering or Geological Sciences
• Graduate-level course work supporting a strong technical knowledge of the principles of soil mechanics and geotechnical design
Ideally, you’ll also have:
Knowledge of computer programs for geotechnical analysis
• Experience with geotechnical site characterization, deep foundation and earth retaining structure design, and seismic evaluations will contribute to your success Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding), age, medical condition, marital or domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression and transgender status, mental disability or physical disability, genetic information, military or veteran status, citizenship, low-income status or any other status or characteristic protected by applicable law. Learn more about your rights under Federal EEO laws and supplemental language.

At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private sector.

Based in (NYC), you’ll have the chance to perform geotechnical engineering design and analysis of foundation systems, retaining structures and slopes for transportation infrastructure projects for both public and private clients. Your engineering skills will be developed with design and analysis of shallow and deep foundations including piles and drilled shafts, retaining walls and support of excavation systems.
You’ll also inspect geotechnical exploratory and construction related activities and specifically, develop as well as oversight of subsurface investigation and laboratory testing programs.
You’ll work with the best Engineers and Project Managers in the business. We want you to be empowered to deliver the boldest solutions for everyday living. If you want to join a company invested in you and your success- join us as an Entry Level Geotechnical Engineer.
At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.
Typical salary range for this position is $64,000 to $80,000 and is commensurate with experience relative to the position.
Here’s What You’ll Need:
Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering with a focus in Geotechnical Engineering
Flexibility to travel for office and field assignments
Strong analytical, conceptual, and organizational skills
Familiarity with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Ideally, you’ll also have:
At least a 3.0 GPA
MS degree in Geotechnical Engineering
Engineer in Training (EIT) or ability to obtain within 6 months.
Previous internship in geotechnical evaluations soil and rock classification, design analysis of foundation and ground retention systems
Knowledge of and experience with Ensoft APile, LPile, and Group, Slide or GeoStudio Slope, GRLWeap, DeepEXcav, Civiltech Shoring Suite, Bentley gINT, Bentley MicroStation, and AutoCAD

Title: Staff Geotechnical Engineer
Job Description:
Company Overview:
Contour Engineering, a Universal Engineering Sciences (UES) Company has an opening for a Staff Geotechnical Engineer based out of our Tifton office.
Contour specializes in geotechnical engineering, environmental/natural resource consulting, and construction materials testing services. Operating from our Georgia and Alabama offices, Contour's staff consists of qualified and experienced engineers, environmental scientists, ecologists, and geologists. Come become a part of our family. We have a great benefits package including medical, dental, 401k match and much more.
About Contour
Since 2000, Contour has provided essential engineering services and has contributed to the success of some of the most prominent and significant projects in the Southeast. Experienced and proven, Contour is one of the top engineering firms in the Southeast. Our work includes both public and private clients and consists of projects ranging from transportation and healthcare to commercial and education. Our engineers, geologists, certified inspections, and scientists offer an unwavering commitment to excellence, approaching each project as an opportunity to cultivate enduring relationships with our clients.
Built on experience and driven by a determination to see our clients through to success, Contour remains focused, optimistic, and grounded in excellence.
Growth
In 2020, GFA International, Inc., Nova Geotechnical & Inspection Services, Contour Engineering, and Wallace-Kuhl & Associates strategically merged with UES becoming part of the Universal Engineering Sciences brand of companies—making us the fastest growing, most experienced, resource-rich organization of its kind. Become an important part of our growing family of nearly 1,800 professionals across 33 branches and help contribute to the betterment of communities all across our nation.
Why Work at Contour?
· Our family atmosphere promotes a small company feel, even as we continue to grow and expand our regional and national footprint.
· Health Plans – Contour employees can choose from three different health plan options including our flagship Health Savings Account (HSA) plan with low premiums and company matching funds deposited directly into your own Health Savings Account!
· Our dental and vision plans offer both in and out of network benefits, giving you the choice to stay with a favorite dentist, orthodontist, or optometrist.
· 401k – Save for retirement with Empower and get a company matching contribution of 50% on the first 6% of compensation, up to $2,000 maximum match.
· There’s plenty of time off too! Contour employees accrue generous amounts of Paid Time Off (PTO), and Paid Holidays!
Construction Materials Testing & Inspections
Contour offers a broad range of materials and lab testing for a variety of projects, from complex roadway construction to single -family residential communities. Our precise testing and quality control offerings successfully guide our clients through stringent project specifications, difficult construction schedules, and complex government regulations with ease. We understand that the most sophisticated technology is wasted without an excellent team trained to maximize its use. That’s why every member of our testing team offers expertise in sampling techniques, testing procedures, verification procedures, and the application of various buildings materials. Together with our ground-breaking technology, our testing services remain unmatched.
Job Description:
The Staff Engineer for the Geotechnical Department performs Geotechnical Consulting for various projects in and around the Tifton area.
Job Responsibilities:
Responsible for conducting, analyzing, and interpreting lab data and evaluating existing geotechnical conditions to determine soil classifications and mechanical properties
Responsible for preparing geotechnical report for bridges, roadways, buildings, signs, retaining walls, lighting, and drainage improvements
Providing geotechnical evaluations and recommendations for deep and shallow foundations, soil improvements, and site preparations
Responsible for inspecting and approving construction of subsurface structures such as: Auger Cast-in Pile, Drilled Shaft, Driven Piles, Helical Piles, Micro-Piles, etc.
Partially involved in geotechnical instrumentation installation monitoring and data readings such as: strain gauges, inclinometers, extensometers, mass concrete temperature sensors, surface and utility monitoring points, etc.
Responsible for coordinating all geotechnical subsurface explorations and investigations
Analyzes reports, maps, drawings, blueprints, tests, and aerial photographs on soil composition, terrain, hydrological characteristics, and other topographical and geologic data to plan and design project.
Markets geotechnical consulting services to clients; uses marketing skills and local contacts to find new clients and increase our share of the market
Prepares cost proposals and designs scope of work for prospective clients.
Calculates cost and determines feasibility of project based on analysis of collected data.
Attends meetings to present technical data to the client and other professionals.
Prepares or directs preparation and modification of reports, specifications, plans, testing schedules and designs for project.
Uses computer-assisted engineering and design software and equipment to prepare engineering and design documents.
Perform construction materials testing duties including concrete and soil density testing.
Report Data in a complete, timely and understandable fashion.
Ensure that all test equipment is functioning properly, maintained as required by company and/or manufacturer's policy and that all calibrated equipment is within its calibration cycle
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering required.
Engineering Intern (E.I.) Certification highly preferred
Check out our website! http://contoureng.com/
Check us out on Facebook! https://www.facebook.com/pages/category/Engineering-Service/Contour-Engineering-1644262888937134/

EEO/AA/Disability/Veteran Universal Engineering Sciences is a Drug-Free Workplace. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job.

Benefits:
401(k)
401(k) matching
Dental insurance
Employee assistance program
Health insurance
Health savings account
Paid time off
Vision insurance
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Education:
Bachelor's (Preferred)
Work Location: One location

Health insurance

Title: Staff Geotechnical Engineer
Job Description:
Discover your full potential. At Tetra Tech, we are collaborating with industry-leading experts for a sustainable future for our world. We combine consulting and engineering with advanced analytics and technology to solve the world’s most complex challenges. Our innovation hubs across the globe will enable you to share ideas and best practices while growing your professional network. Wherever you are in your career journey, you will benefit from working with world-class engineers, scientists, and technical specialists.
Apply today and join the company that is Leading with Science®.

Summary: Tetra Tech invites you to consider a rewarding opportunity within our Missoula, Montana office as a Staff Geotechnical Engineer. We are currently seeking an energetic individual interested in supporting a variety of challenging projects in a fast-paced environment. We currently have a diverse geotechnical engineer staff of four and a full-scale geotechnical laboratory. The Missoula office also has an accredited construction materials field and laboratory testing and inspection group with a staff of eight in the Missoula office. Our projects allow engineers to work and travel throughout Montana and the United States on a variety of projects, most of it within the spectacular Rocky Mountain West region. Typical geotechnical projects include the entire spectrum of geotechnical engineering, including; soil and rock slope stability analyses and design, shallow and deep foundation analysis and design, bridge and highway corridor design, rigid and flexible pavement design, field instrumentation and monitoring, deep foundation load testing, and construction oversight and inspection. In addition, experience in the civil, environmental, hydrology or hydraulics fields is a plus.
Your Role:
Field engineer for geotechnical drilling projects.
Perform geotechnical field reconnaissance.
Assist with geophysical field investigations.
Perform construction materials testing in lab and field.
Assist with geotechnical report preparation.
Assist in preparing proposals and cost estimates for new work.
Perform geotechnical oversight on construction projects.
Professionally interact with clients in meetings, phone calls, and emails.
Strictly adhere to company health and safety standards and expectations.
Qualifications:
Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering with Geotechnical/Materials emphasis, or related Geological Engineering degree.
One to five years of experience in geotechnical engineering field preferred.
EI/EIT license with ability to obtain PE within 4-5 years desirable.
Proficient in MS Office Suite. Familiarity with AutoCAD, ArcGIS, gINT, and MathCAD software desired.
Able to perform analysis, calculations, and designs with current geotechnical design software.
Familiarity with geotechnical lab testing and construction materials testing desired.
Strong problem solving, time management, organization, writing and speaking skills are required.
A Pre-employment drug screening in compliance with state regulations is required.
Must possess a valid driver's license with a clean driving record without restrictions.

Target salary range: $54,000 to $65,000. The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position based on experience and other factors.

About Tetra Tech:
At Tetra Tech, health and safety play a vital role in our success. Tetra Tech’s employees work together to comply with all applicable health & safety practices and protocols, including health orders and regulations related to COVID-19 that are mandated by local, state and federal authorities.
Tetra Tech offers the following optional benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, Prescription, Accidental Death & Dismemberment, Long & Short-Term Disability, Health & Dependent Care Flexible Spending. Financial Benefits: Group Term Life, Optional Group Term Life Insurance, Business Travel Accident Insurance, Health Savings Account, 401K, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Time Off with Pay, Employee Assistance Program, Adoption Assistance, Leaves of Absence.
Tetra Tech combines the resources of a global, multibillion-dollar company with local, client-focused delivery in more than 550 locations around the world. Our reputation rests on the technical expertise and dedication of our employees—27,000 associates working together to provide smart, scalable solutions for challenging projects. We are proud to be home to leading technical experts in water, environment, infrastructure, resource management, energy, and international development.

Title: Entry Level Geotechnical Engineer
Job Description:
Company Description

We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed. You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients. We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business. We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career. When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

Job Description

At AECOM, we’re delivering a better world.

We believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether it’s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive.

Our clients trust us to bring together the best people, ideas, technical expertise and digital solutions to our work in transportation, buildings, water, the environment and new energy. We’re one global team – over 50,000 strong – driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world.

Enterprise Capabilities is a service-led organization within AECOM, enabling access to a global talent pool. With offices in India, China, Spain, Poland, Romania, South Africa and the Philippines, our teams of technical professionals provide around the clock project support assisting AECOM teams around the world to deliver faster, smarter and better. Enterprise Capabilities supports AECOM’s ability to work as one global team by standardizing design processes, deploying collaboration technologies, and utilizing a connected network of technical expertise. By joining Enterprise Capabilities, you will have the unique opportunity to work on AECOM’s monumental projects located around the world, contributing to our purpose of delivering a better world.

AECOM is seeking an Entry Level Geotechnical Engineer to be based in Austin, TX, and, or open to locations in Dallas, Fort Worth, Houston, Baton Rouge, LA, and/or New Orleans, LA.

This position is expected to begin in June 2023.

Job Summary/Responsibilities
Use computer programs including GeoStudio, UTexas4, LPILE, GROUP, SHAFT, Plaxis, FLAC, Settle3D, and MathCAD for geotechnical analyses
Assist in the procurement of subcontract drilling and laboratory testing services
Establish boring locations in the field
Supervise field drilling operations and construction inspections
Complete laboratory testing assignments
Perform quality control checks on the laboratory test results
Prepare Health, Safety, and Environmental (HSE) and drilling plans
Develop design parameters of the soils and rock
Perform geotechnical analyses to determine the bearing capacity, settlement, stability, and other characteristics of the subsurface materials
Complete geotechnical reports and proposals for review by senior technical staff
Complete analyses to determine the most cost-effective foundation design solutions
Work on high-profile design and construction projects for USACE, TxDOT, USIBWC, NRCS, TCEQ local governments, etc.
Work on projects that reduce the risk of floodings, like new designs or improvement designs for levees, floodwalls, floodgates, dams, penstocks, tunnels, stormwater pump stations, channels, and bank stabilization.
Additionally, you could work on Design Build projects for both flood control projects and highways.
Design embankment stabilization and under-seepage solutions.
Design MSE walls and bridge foundations
Learn about mitigation strategies for expansive soils and soft, organic soils, or karstic limestone foundations.

Qualifications

Minimum Requirements :
Graduated from ABET accredited university with Bachelor's Degree in Civil Engineering and
Certification for Engineer in Training (EIT), or must obtain within 6 months after the start of employment
Driver's license is required for this position, and motor vehicle records may be requested
Preferred Qualifications :
Master’s Degree in Geotechnical Engineering.
Prior experience 0-3 years
Ability to work on fast-paced complex projects
Ability to work on multiple ongoing projects at the same time
Willing to work overtime if needed to complete a task to meet the client’s schedule or request
Detail-oriented and technical
Highly motivated self-starter

Additional Information
Relocation is not available.
Sponsorship is not available.
With infrastructure investment accelerating worldwide, our services are in great demand, and there’s never been a better time to be at AECOM! Join us, and you’ll get all the benefits of being a part of a global, publicly traded firm – access to industry-leading technology and thinking and transformational work with big impact and work flexibility.
AECOM provides a wide array of compensation and benefits programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. We also provide a robust global well-being program. We’re the world’s trusted global infrastructure firm, and we’re in this together – your growth and success are ours too.
As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.
Join us and let’s get started.

Title: Construction Materials Testing - Full Time / Part Time Technician
Job Description:
Come join our team as a construction materials engineering technician! By providing our clients the services they required in a timely and cost-effective manner, we have grown to be one of the leading engineering firms in the Midwest. Providing environmental services, geotechnical engineering, and construction quality control. During its 45-plus year history, Alt & Witzig engineering has worked with a variety of clients on some of the largest and most complex projects in the Midwest.
We believe in a culture of promoting from within, looking to our exceptional technicians prior to posting an ad. Whether you have an education in related fields, or not, Alt & Witzig engineering is a great place to start your career in the construction industry.
-Entry level lab/field technician position with on the job training. However, experience / education with construction testing field work/experience and certifications (ACI, ICC, NICET, INDOT, or OSHA) will be considered for pay rate.
-Part time positions available for various schedules.
-A company vehicle and gas card are provided for field work.
-Overtime is available but not required.
Job Qualifications:
-High school diploma or equivalent (preferred)
-Valid driver's license and background check (preferred)
-Self-motivated and reliable (required)
-Basic math skills and effective verbal / written communication skills (required)
-Degree in construction management, materials science, geology, civil engineering or training in construction / civil engineering (preferred)
-Graduates, AND students are encouraged to apply
-Ability to lift or move up to 50 lbs. of material / equipment (required)
Job Responsibilities:
-Prepare and perform testing of soil, aggregate, and concrete samples in the lab and field as directed or in accordance with company training.
-Assist with sampling of construction materials (soils, aggregates, asphalt) and other materials as directed.
-Operate testing equipment accurately and efficiently.
-Maintain documentation of testing data.
- Calculate and deliver test results to supervising technician, manager, or engineer.
-May train lower-level technicians.
-Assist other technicians or professional staff on routine tasks.

Title: Entry Level Geotechnical Engineering Graduate
Job Description:
Our People & Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the "why" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.

Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.


Your Impact:

Jacobs has a great opportunity for an entry-level geotechnical engineer to join our Chicago, Illinois or Milwaukee, Wisconsin offices.
You would work with our local practice of 9 geotechnical engineers as well as over 100 geotechnical and geological engineers in 22 offices across North America, and over 500 professionals globally. As an entry-level geotechnical engineer, you will have the opportunity to follow projects through conceptual, design, and construction phases, working on traditional design-bid-build, design-build, progressive-design-build, and P3 projects. You will be on multi-disciplinary teams supporting transportation (highway, rail, maritime), water infrastructure, and environmental projects.
As an entry-level geotechnical engineer, you will:
Participate in field assignments that will include observation of explorations (soil and rock borings, test pits, CPT soundings, geophysical testing); geotechnical instrumentation and monitoring; and inspection of the construction of geotechnical structures (earth retaining structures, deep foundations, tunnels, and shallow/deep foundations)
Travel to and work in locations throughout the USA and occasionally overseas.
Design shallow and deep foundations, earth retaining structures, ground improvement, embankments, and cut slopes.
Analyze laboratory and field exploration results and select geotechnical design parameters.
Prepare and review technical reports, data reports and baseline reports.
Become competent with commercial software programs including gINT, Settle3D, Slide, FB Multipier, LPILE, Shaft, APile, DeepEx, GRLWEAP, Plaxis, and Geostudio.
Perpare design drawings and construction specifications, and review construction submittals for compliance with contract requirements and design assumptions.
Share technical knowledge across geographical and discipline boundaries to foster innovative project solutions.
Here’s What You’ll Need:
Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering or Geological Engineering with Geotechnical Emphasis (Master's degree preferred)
0 to 4 years of experience in geotechnical engineering and consulting
Professional engineering license or working towards licensure
Able to demonstrate strong technical knowledge of soil mechanics
Strong communication skills and problem-solving skills
Willingness and flexibility to travel for work
Experience in subsurface exploration and construction oversight a plus

Title: Geotechnical Engineer I, II, III (entry level to about 3 years exp)
Job Description:
ANS Geo is an emerging engineering consulting firm looking for career minded Geotechnical Engineers to join our team. If you are an individual that is
· motivated to progress your career,
· willing to work outside of your comfort zone to grow,
· and values collaboration, communication, and respect,
then you find yourself surrounded by like-minded team members at ANS Geo. Our talented team as allowed us to grow quickly along with the growing Renewables Energymarket, and with that growth, we can provide ample opportunities for your career growth in conjunction.
While we do work across multiple markets, and provide diverse civil engineering services, we are primarily looking for Geotechnical Engineers to perform and lead subsurface investigations for Solar and Wind Farm projects across the United States. If you are excited by the opportunity to see new places and geologies across the United States, and to support the growing Renewable Energy market in the US, this is the perfect opportunity for you.
We are looking for candidates to work out of any one of our five offices, all of which have at least one PE working locally:
· South Plainfield, NJ
· Austin, TX
· Albany, NY
· Charlottesville, VA
· Columbus, OH
“Must-have” profile of the successful candidate include:
· BS in Civil Engineering, or related degree
· Valid US Drivers License, and a reliable means of transportation
· Ability to travel, for extended periods of times (two to three weeks)
· Proficiency with Microsoft Office products
“Nice-to-have” skills for the successful candidate may include:
· Engineer-in-Training (EIT) certificate
· Prior experience with geotechnical investigations, including soil borings, rock coring, and material testing
· Prior experience with geotechnical software (gINT, GeoStudio, LPILE, ALLPILE, DeepEx, etc.)
· Experience with design of foundations, support of excavation systems, and preparing reports
· Experience with AutoCAD a plus, AutoCAD 3D even better
· Experience in geophysical testing and evaluations, including active and passive MASW and ERI.
The challenge that lies ahead include:
· Working alongside a team of high-performing engineering and technical professionals
· Performing geotechnical field investigations, construction observation, and engineering evaluation and technical analysis
· Preparing technical reports and summaries, and interfacing directly with coworkers, clients, and stakeholders to communicate findings and recommendations
· Completing technical analyses, including foundation design, support of excavation, and other engineering evaluations
· Actively participating in your career growth, including the opportunity to join elective continuing education courses, being involved in community and professional societies, and managing projects and experiences that stretch you outside of your comfort zone to grow you as a professional.
Benefits include but not limited to:
· Hybrid remote and in office work schedules
· Free health care (ANS Geo covers 100% of health care premiums)
· 4% company matchon 401(k) contributions OR student loan payments
· Flexible PTO up to 4-weeks to use any way you like!
· Supplemental Weekend Pay for work or travel on Saturdays or Sundays
· Potential performance bonuses
· Training and Development programs
· Reimbursement for Professional Licensure
· Paid Holidays and a winter and summer breaks for all team members
· Environment built on mutual trust and respect, and surrounded by a high performing team

Pay: $65,000.00 - $82,000.00 per year

Title: Engineer in Training (Entry-level), Geotechnical
Job Description:
Do you want to help engineer what's next?
Simpson Gumpertz & Heger (SGH) is a national engineering firm committed to delivering holistic advice for our clients' most complex challenges. We leverage our collective and diverse experience, technical expertise, and industry knowledge of structures and building enclosures, advanced analysis, code consulting, and applied science & research to deliver unrivaled, comprehensive solutions that drive superior performance. With more than 600 employees in eight office locations throughout the United States, SGH's industry-leading teams constantly seek to advance the meaning of what's possible.
We want someone passionate about geotechnical engineering and problem solving.
The Heavy Civil Division provides engineering services with emphasis on investigation, repair, and rehabilitation of a variety of deteriorated or underperforming structures, as well as new design of constructed works. The ideal candidate will support the continued development of a wide array of geotechnical, geo-structural, and construction engineering services within SGH. The candidate will be expected to have a strong technical background to support our work by conducting geotechnical and geo-structural analyses, preparing drawings and specifications, researching technical issues, writing reports, conducting field visits, and performing construction administration activities.
What You'll Be Doing:
Perform various types of engineering analyses and design associated with deep and shallow foundations, earth retaining structures, excavation support systems, soil settlement, slope stability, soil dynamics and earthquake engineering, groundwater flow and seepage, earthen embankments/dams/reservoirs, tunnels, and asphalt and concrete pavement.
Assist in planning, scheduling, conducting and/or coordinating field and laboratory services for a wide range of project types including new design, forensic investigations, and repair/remediation.
Assist in preparing reports.
Assist in the preparation of drawings and project specifications suitable for construction.
Perform construction administration and construction monitoring duties.
Assist in the preparation of scope, schedules, and budgets for proposals.
Perform
What You'll Need:
MS with a concentration in Geotechnical or GeoStructural Engineering.
Communication skills: excellent written, oral and verbal communication skills. Ability to convey information to internal and external clients clearly.
Problem-solving ability: capability to solve minor or complex problems using data, logic, and judgement. Strong attention to detail with excellent analytical skills.
Team-oriented mindset – ability to work successfully with others toward a shared goal with active participation.
Accountability and responsibility - ability to meet deadlines. Willingness to take independent initiative to ensure tasks are completed.
Enthusiasm, passion, and desire for continued learning of new ideas and concepts.
Familiarity with geotechnical computer analysis software preferred (e.g., GEOSLOPE Suite, Slide, Plaxis, LPILEplus, CIVILTech Shoring, DeepEX, Settle3D, etc.)
Valid driver's license and an acceptable Motor Vehicle Report.
Willingness to travel to out-of-state project sites on occasion and ability to travel to remote job sites not accessible by public transportation.
FE/EIT certification, preferred.
What makes careers at SGH so special?
The only way to advance is to question and explore. Every member of the SGH team is both a learner and an educator, committed to advancing ourselves, our teams, and our industry. Together we are creating a community that never settles for what is, but always seeks what could be.
There are many reasons to love SGH.
Our Work: Our clients trust us to bring clarity and deliver outstanding solutions for their most complex projects.
Our People: We are bold thinkers and compassionate teammates, committed to lifelong learning and professional growth.
Our Commitment: We live with integrity and embrace an obligation to give back to our professions and communities.
Our Contribution: We offer a comprehensive and rich compensation and benefits package with company-paid and voluntary programs to help build healthy lifestyles, strong relationships, and future prosperity.

SGH is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we value diversity in our workforce. We are committed to providing equal opportunities to all job applicants and employees. We consider all qualified applicants and encourage individuals with disabilities and protected veterans to apply. If the application system is not accessible to you, or you need a reasonable accommodation to apply due to a disability, please email jobs@sgh.com.

Title: Staff Geotechnical Engineer
Job Description:
Description
It is our mission to be the best geotechnical engineering firm in the Rocky Mountain northwest with a strong emphasis on challenging infrastructure projects including bridges, highways, and landslides. We are seeking a Staff Geotechnical Engineer to complement our current staff of 8 geotechnical engineers, geologist and materials engineer. The ideal candidate will be a motivated individual with strong communication skills, strong technical background in geotechnical engineering, and highly organized to manage geotechnical projects and work with our team of engineers, technicians and drillers.
Requirements
4 year Bachelor of Science degree in Civil Engineering, Masters Degree preferred, but not required.
Successful completion of Fundamentals of Engineering exam and ability to obtain Professional registration in the state of Montana within 4 years.
Solid understanding of geotechnical principals and methods of analysis.
Strong communication skills and highly organized.
Ability to work with others.
Ability to travel and work outdoors.
Specific Duties and Responsibilities
Independently performs project assignments.
Plans, schedules, conducts and coordinates projects of low to moderate complexity.
Develops proposals and related scope of work for new projects with review from senior-level staff.
Plans, schedules, conducts and coordinates projects of low to moderate complexity.
Prepares geotechnical engineering reports for review by senior level staff.
Performs research and writes reports giving professional opinions and recommendations for review by senior-level staff.
Uses computer programs to evaluate settlement, axial and lateral capacity of deep foundations, slope stability, pavement design, liquefaction and other engineering problems and draft reports.
Supervises technicians and drillers on project specific basis.
Perform field tests, such as concrete and compaction, when necessary
Monitors budgets of projects and ensures project invoicing and bill payment occurs in a timely fashion.
Prepares construction field reports documenting contractors' work methods, test results and the interpretation of these observations and tests.
Travel for project or training, as required.
Becomes active in state and national professional societies.
Why SK Geotechnical?
We strongly believe we provide a challenging, learning environment to provide a rewarding career in geotechnical engineering, and are looking for an individual with strong communication and technical skills to join us in taking our firm to the next level.
Benefits
Competitive salary - Estimated yearly salary equates to 55K to 65K per year, depending on experience and overtime
Health savings account contribution and high deductible health plan
401K Plan with Match
Profit Sharing
Seven paid holidays
Up to 4 weeks of accumulated sick leave, 6 days per year
Up to three weeks' vacation
Life Insurance
This position is based in our Billings, Montana office. This is your chance to join the top geotechnical engineering firm in Montana and work on exciting and challenging projects in the beautiful Rocky Mountain region.
SK Geotechnical is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

Pay: $65,000.00 - $69,000.00 per year

8 hour shift

Title: Entry Level CMT Lab Technician
Job Description:
Ardaman & Associates, Inc. is one of the largest geotechnical engineering and materials testing consulting firms in the Southeastern U.S. Over our history, we have worked on more than 150,000 projects throughout the Southeast, the U.S., and worldwide. This vast list of project experience includes services for virtually every type of public and private client associated with industrial, commercial and infrastructure projects.

Ardaman has the following opportunities available:

ENTRY LEVEL CMT LAB TECHNICIAN
This an entry level position for a full-time employee interested in pursuing a career in construction materials testing. Work includes preparatory processes and tests on samples of soil, rock, concrete, asphalt, and various other materials following established guidelines. Paid training including industry certifications will be provided.

Qualifications:
At least 18 years old
The ability to lift and carry equipment weighing up to 50 lbs.
The ability to perform mathematical calculations
The ability to work weekends and extended hours as needed
Must be able to pass background screening requirements including criminal history, drug testing, etc.
Local candidates only; no relocation.

We offer a comprehensive benefits program including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, paid time off, 401(k) with company match, and much more.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and we value workplace diversity. We invite resumes from all interested parties including women, minorities, veterans and persons with disabilities. Ardaman is a wholly owned subsidiary of Tetra Tech, who is a VEVRAA federal contractor and we request priority referral of veterans for available positions. Ardaman is a Drug Free Workplace.

Title: Engineering Technician (Construction Materials Testing)
Job Description:
NOVA Engineering & Environmental is seeking full-time Engineering Technicians (Construction Materials Testing) in the Norcross, GA metro area.
We offer training (both on-the-job and classroom) to support and encourage staff in obtaining certifications in the fields of aggregate, asphalt, soil, reinforced concrete and masonry. Pay rate is based on level of experience and active certifications.
The individual will be responsible for the following:
Field testing of soil, concrete, asphalt, aggregate, and masonry mortar/grout for compliance with ASTM, AASHTO, DOT, and/or project specifications
Review of blueprints in preparation of field observations on construction sites
Documentation of field activities, observations, and testing results on construction projects, and their conformance with (or deviation from) project plans and specifications
Daily use of Metafield, and/or other field and laboratory information management systems, for recording of testing results
Communication of field and laboratory testing results with Construction Services and Geotechnical Project Management staff, general contractors, and clients
Calibration of field and laboratory equipment to industry codes and standards
Qualifications:
2+ years of experience in construction testing/inspections of soil, concrete, masonry, and/or asphalt materials is preferred
ACI, ICC, and GDOT certifications are a huge plus
Ability to routinely lift 40 to 50 lbs. (field/laboratory samples and equipment), required
Willingness to work outdoors in varying weather conditions (Company will provide Personal Protective Equipment and inclement weather gear, as appropriate)
Ability to work and maneuver equipment (such as a loaded wheelbarrow) on uneven ground and around active construction sites
Willingness to travel out-of-town (typically overnight) for short duration assignments
Check out our Perks:
In addition to our welcoming company culture and competitive compensation packages, our employees enjoy the below benefits:
Use of take-home Company Vehicle and gas card for daily travel to work sites
Comprehensive group medical insurance, including health, dental and vision
Opportunity for professional growth and advancement
Certification reimbursement
Paid time off
Company-observed paid holidays
Company paid life insurance for employee, spouse and children
Company paid short term disability coverage
Other supplemental benefit offerings including long-term disability, critical illness, accident and identity theft protection
401K retirement with company matching of 50% on the first 6% of employee contributions
Wellness program with incentives
Employee Assistance Program
